comment: Found this bar only by hearing the band playing, Eric Clapton - I think! Climbed the staircase to find it,a welcome Oasis from the the trinkets and shopping of the night market
Near Night Bazaar with great blues band, great music and atmosphere. Also good service from bar, prices was OK.

I purposely hunted this venue having read the reviews and had a fantastic night. Its an interesting location and there were plenty of people to chat to. The live bands were extremely talented. I really recommend this place for a fun night out

Second time visiting this bar. Found it last business trip by chance after hearing the blues music waft down from above the night market. Couldnt wiat to return one year later and find it just as good. Superb staff to serve you drinks and the music is superb especially if you like Blues but it caters for varied tastes. I like the way that people appeared, took out their guitars and other varied musical instruments and started to play so line up varies. Your host is a wonderful musician. Charming guy with lots of charisma. I really recommend visiting this place for a few beers and a musical treat.
I don't usually listen to this type of music, but I was really impressed and was very happy. I'll definitely visit it again! Very cool place!

Boy and his pals had a right jam and made us feel like the family, Pink Floyd covers were pretty special as was Jimmy Hendrix, we were last to leave I was gutted we only found this gem on our last night, we will be back tho! Cheers guys!

My expectations were average, especially as the bar is located near the Night Bazaar where you get a lot of tourist traffic. Drink prices are average, waitress serves to your table and there are plenty of seats. I was seriously impressed by the performances and now have marked this a regular spot I will be going back to for live music. Boy- the main act, is playful, entertaining and exceptional on the electric guitar. There were local expats who got up on the stage and sang some covers, which added to the whole experience. Looking around the bar, everyone was mesmerized by his stage presence as he held us all in the palm of his hand. Energetic rock and roll vibes with goosebump-inducing performances, that I'd highly recommend. Lives up to the hype.
Nice people, good atmosphere, and great music (strongly recommend to go on a Monday, the jamming night!)

I went to Boy Blues Bar after reading the recommendations on TA, and I'm so glad I did! It's in the night bazar, on the upper level. The atmosphere was great and the music was fantastic! A must if in Chiang Mai!

We came across this place by accident after hearing live blues across the market. We followed the sound and proceeded upstairs to Boy Blues Bar. Great little spot above the market with a decent bar, friendly staff and quality bands that you would have to pay entry to see in the UK. Highly recommend for a beer and a chill.

My partner and I stumbled across this little mezzanine bar when exploring the night markets. The bar staff are so friendly and are constantly walking around serving you and making you feel comfortable. And oh the music, what an unlikely place to find excellent blues but it was completely amazing! The two bands that played both nights were so well polished and super talented. We were so stoked we came back the following night to watch again and will definitely be back there again when we have a chance. My favourite place in Chiang Mai so far!

Wow What great times we had Thanks Boy you really rocked and to all the other Farang (Foreigners) who joined in with Saxes Trumpets and mouth organ really had the place rocking Also to the Ausie singer who calls in to share her fantastic raspy voice you couldnt get any better entertainment and its all free I found the write up in the Jetstar inflight magazine and it lived up to everything and more Im coming Back

Found this place by accident - despite it being in the middle of the night market we hadn't seen it mentioned in any guides. Sooo glad we found it though! The band are incredibly talented and afer we got chatting to them afterwards we discovered that they are lovely lovely guys. A great chill out spot to have a couple of beers and listen to some fantastic music.

Me and my boyfriend went to Boys Blue on Saturday night and well... What an absolute pleasure!! This place is a hidden gem and was just what you need in Chiang Mai! The bands we brilliant everyone up and dancing , set above the night bazaar market! Make sure you check this out guys you will NOT be disappointed! The bar is closed Sundays.

I was looking for a great live music venue to visit during my time in Chiang Mai and stumbled upon Boy Blues Bar on trip advisor. If you love blues and rock'n'roll this is the place to go. Located in a small upstairs section in the Kalare food court/ night bazaar; you will hear this place before you see it. I went there on a Friday and Saturday night and found the Friday to be much better and busier. This was most likely due to the owner himself - Boy, playing with his own band. He was an exceptional guitarist and had an old school blues legend vibe about him. Average priced drinks with table service. Great music. Great vibe. Will definitely be returning next time I'm in Chiang Mai

If you just wish to hang out & chill, and listen to some great music, then this is the place. First time I went, it was just great to be above the markets, cheap drinks, plenty of seating & top tunes. and it's on ALL the time, so it's always the place you can go to chill out! awesome!
Nice spot above Kalar night markets. Good music. Monday open Mike night was great surprise. Seats are very low so not good if you have a bad back. Waitress seemed a bit out of sorts night we went.

Live bluesy music almost every night (closed on Sundays) but invariable it's a cover band playing cheesey rock or blues (official name 'blue cheese?') so if dad rock is your thing head this way.... I could quite easily get smashed on Samsong whiskey and listen to some live guitar but the location is also a let down: it's situated inside the night market - making it feel like an attraction rather than a bar.

The bar is a low key, open rooftop establishment but don’t let this put you off. The service is excellent and our waiter could not have looked after us better. The music is absolutely outstanding. We arrived with Warren from Ice and Earth performing and thoroughly enjoyed his soulful performance of original blues songs. We could have listened to him for hours!! This was followed by the great Boy Blue himself. He specialises in rock blues and demonstrated his remarkable technical competence on the guitar. We had a wonderful time and I would definitely recommend this bar.

What a delight for blues rock music lovers. I went along with a friend for the Monday night jams sessions and was not disappointed. In fact it was easily one of the best nights amongst Chiang Mai's thriving music scene.

Stumbled upon this place on my last trip to Chiang Mai and still play back the great vibes in my head. It's easy to find... go to the inside portion of the night bazaar and follow the sound of great guitar licks played with real passion. From Hendrix to John Lee Hooker to Carlos Santanait all gets done with respect and a wide Asian smile. The drinks are reasonable, the atmosphere is pleasant and yes... there is smoking but unlike others have reported it is a bit annoying but the fab music makes up for it. There is a tip box in front of the stage and I encourage you to throw in a respectable amount of baht as the entertainment is first class. The crowd is multicultural and the staff is attentive but not pushy. I don't care where you're from... If you enjoy great blues played by some guys who love music and aren't afraid to show it.. DO NOT miss an evening at this place. Khob Khun Krub Boy - You and the guys Rock!!
This is a cool bar. Great live music from talented locals. The owner is an awesome guy. Relaxed atmosphere. Drinks prices are very fair. Good location as well.

great live music by very talented musicians with multiple bands and little rest between - excellent atmosphere and great service at a reasonable price - hard to find at first so just follow the music up the stairs

What a show on a Monday evening, Boy with a backup of 10-12 guest musicians, all playing making space and music together. Boy´s sound is just heavenly, his music is warm, happy and electric, the band knows their gig, I find it truly a great spot, to cheer up, feel happy being around people who all love the blues. Boy play lot of great tracks, some of the very best from the blues and rock start. He adds his own finger print being a true artist creating sound on a guitar. The best blues music found in Chiang Mai so far.

We stumbled across this place by accident after hearing some passer by talking about it whilst we were in a different bar. It’s ace, a bluesy busy bar with live bands. By the end of the night everyone was up dancing and we had one of the best nights we have had since being in Thailand. It’s about 90 Bart for a Chang and 140 Bart for a gin and tonic so prices pretty reasonable for a fun place. Hidden away on the second level of the night bizarre. It’s in the indoor market part called kalare night market. U do have to pay to go to the public toilet in the middle of the market but it’s only a short walk away and you get charged 5 Bart for you’re trouble. All in all we had a fab night so thankyou the end band we absolutely awesome played some great tunes :)

This guy is seriously entertaining. His cheeky smile is infectious. What I liked most about him though, is his ability to convey his personality through his playing. I chatted with him after the show and he was exactly as I thought he'd be. If you like live music in general you will absolutely love this guy. The support act were pretty damn incredible too. Best night out in Chiang Mai.

I'll be honest I've watched this bar blossom over the years and the music gets better however the bar this year was a real disappointment. Overpriced spirit, the jack daniels tasted suspiciously like sang son and the g and t very cheap gin. But dont be put off - go and support the local talent and stick to bottled beer.
As the title of my review says, "THE BEST LITTLE LIVE MUSIC BAR IN CHIANG MAI!" sometimes you'll struggle to get a seat here becaude the place is just sooooo good!

I usually go here a lot when I'm in town. It's changed a bit over last year but still great. They have always had a few rock acts on but now they have some younger bands on, some playing a bit of funk. I think Boy is trying to offer a range of music and give new bands a go.I'm into blues and rock but I must admit to having enjoyed the mix. Some of the bands do a circuit each night, so you may see an act at, say, Bus Bar, and catch them at Boy's later. Prices are up on drinks but still not excessive considering the entertainment. BT 120 for large Leo. BT 100 for red wine. There is a schedule up on the wall at bottom of stairs. Open every night now. Please note midnight closing almost everywhere in CM nowadays. Blame police, not bars.

In I hidden spot over the Night Bazaar. We were attracted by the sound and the buzz coming from the bar. Seemed packed with regulars and had a good welcoming vibe. Music was vintage and live and well received by the crowd

A very pleasant place to spend an evening. Boy and his band are very good musicians, and everybody who gets to play knows how to play. Also pleasant space - it is an open balcony on top of Kalare market - so you can listen to the music, sip your bear and watch the activities below. The only small snag is that the blues bar doesn't have its own loo - you have to use the general market toilets, which can get quite bad by the end of the day.

Me and my boyfriend stumbled across this whilst at the night bazaar markets. Very simple and down to earth bar but with so much soul. We weren't expecting too much and therefore had a top night. We ended going back for the past 3 nights. Highly recommend for those looking for a chilled vibe with great atmosphere. No strangers here, just friends we have not yet met!

This is one of those places I only ended up visiting because of tripadvisor, but I'm glad I did. chilling with a few beers and listening to great blues is a great antidote to sightseeing and market traipsing. it's in a strange place, elevated in a kind of crows nest at the top of the covered market, open to the air (but covered from rain). This is good as most cigarette smoke is blown away. unlike many blues venues which seem to be banished to dark basements this one feels fresh and is a great spot for people watching. limited drinks menu (beers and spirits) - get some cocktails on there and it would be heaven!

Situated up stairs in the night bazaar..follow the music..the bar offers a great night out with quality musicians. We went on Monday's open mic night..bit of a lottery tbh but still entertaining..and again on a regular evening. The Boy Blues Band are amazing musicians and obviously enjoy what they do. The bar service is very good..the seats aren't the most comfy. Bit of a long haul to the public toilets.

We have been coming to Chiang Mai on and off for the last 7 years and always look forward to spending time at Boy's. Sensational music every night by very talented musicians, great atmosphere, great service and reasonably priced drinks. The Monday night jam session attracts some serious talent, including many foreigners playing a vast array of instruments. Boy himself is a very fine and accomplished blues guitarist with a very clean sound, commanding stage presence and infectious smile, all backed by a wonderful band that work together perfectly. A trip to Boys is a must for any live music lovers visiting Chiang Mai.

Chiangmai is famous for being an artsy town, but it's pretty hard to expect it when ur walking down night bazaar. Then out of the blue, this place appears. Perching on top and in the middle of the nite bazaar, hard to find but worth the find, just follow the music. Your evening will be worth it and it will be a unique memory in Chiangmai. Recommend for those who like great blue music fm this very cool band.
Really entertaining night with some great musicians. If you play an instrument you'll fit in and can get up jamming. If you're in Chiang mai please go down to boys blues bar.

This tiny little upstairs bar is awsome. The music is mellow & makes for a fantastic evening. Located close to the night Bazaar at the rear of the Babylonian Restaurant. Just follow the cool music & you'll end up here! The electric guitar playing was truely awsome & the guy can certainly play. He doesn't just play he puts on a show & has a beaming smile. . I had to buy the band a round of drinks they were sooooo good. This place is well worth a visit if you want a chilled out evening with fantastic sounds.

We were there two nights to relax after a long day and some night-bazaaring. Great to hang out, Boy always had his smile on and never seems to get tired of playing and entertaining. Staff is very friendly, owners always open for a chat. Ask them about the open stage nights (mondays?), if you like to play yourself. Had a special night with guest players Ron (harmonica) and Nick (drums), unforgettable!

We stumbled on this bar on our first night in Chiang Mai, having eaten in Sila Aat in the Night Bazaar. The band was entertaining. Great musicians. We returned twice more. Unfortunately the weather had turned cold so we didn't stay long on the second occasion but on our last night we spent a few hours enjoying 2 bands. Great atmosphere.

This was another gem we found following people's reviews on trip advisor, after going for dinner in the market downstairs we spotted a sign to this bar having recognised the name from the reviews on here we went upstairs and were not disappointed. We went on a Monday night which was open mic which can always be risky however the music was great with amazing musicians including boy blue himself. We ended up staying the whole night- best nights entertainment we have had in Thailand so far! As it is a bar you are not charged to go watch just buy a drink.
Went there on Monday and it was open mic session, everyone was having so much fun with fantastic blues. Drinks was cheap as well.
Great atmosphere, cheap drinks. We went the first time at the open night, the place was packed, had a blast. Then went there every night we were in Chiang Mai.

My wife and I met Boy last year while traveling and his club was amazing. We came back again this year and found it even better. Boy usually has 2 sets, one band until 9:15, and afterwards Boy himself plays the blues until midnight. Boy is one of those gifted people that can play a guitar like he was born with it. He often has musicians in the audience come up and jam, but the amazing part is that it comes together like he has been playing with them for years. You can see boy every night, and every night is just a little different in his guitar playing, he improvises upon his mindset that night. All-in-all, you're certainly in for a great evening of blues that you'll be hard pressed to beat. If you are in Chiang Mai, I recommend you don't miss out on Boy Blues Bar.

Amazing house band, the lead guitarist may just be one of the best reincarnations of Hendrix around! His stage persona is incredible. We were lucky enough to have some additional musos add some great brass to the experience. Really relaxed bar, great drinks and vibe.

I planned on listening to 3 songs and then heading out. The bands were amazing, 2.5 hours later I headed out when the bar closed down. It was so mesmerizing that I did not even realize that I missed dinner. Even if you do not actually go to the bar, the music will float through the air and lift your spirits while you are in the Kalare Night Market.

First of all, who doesn't love great live music in a cool bar? I have been to some very good music venues in Chicago, New York, California and Seattle/Portland. Great music venues can be difficult to find in Thailand with any songs you might recognize from the classic rock and blues era. Boy Blues Bar in Chiang Mai is a true gem! It is the perfect blend of Thai and expat 'farang' musicians who live in Chiang Mai. The Monday night jam night was incredible. There were about a dozen different musicians and they were all very good. The house drummer would give Mitch Mitchell of the Jimi Hendrix band a run for his money! Yes, he was that good! Boy, the owner and lead guitar player, is an awesome guy, and he's got some serious chops on electric guitar. He is probably one of the best blues/rock guitar players in Thailand! He sings very well too. We liked Boy Blues Bar so much we returned for 2 more nights. We went there 3 times in 7 nights. No other music venue in Chiang Mai came close to as good. The bar is covered by a giant roof but it is open to the night air. Chiang Mai is cool at night and fresh air in a bar is nice. Feels like you are outside but still protected from rain. The night market is next door. Great night..eat at and explore the night market and then go to Boy Blues Bar around 8:30pm. Music starts up shortly after. If you are in a large group, get there earlier so you can find seats. The place fills up quickly by 9pm.

We found this place on our 2nd and last week of our holiday and went 4 times. It is absolutely fabulous!! Boy and his boys are the best - they played Santana, Hendrix, and so much more. Open night on a Monday night is also a blast. If you have an instrument or can sing, go along and enjoy. We loved the Indian guy who sang "I'm coming" he held the audience in his hand and apparently is there every Monday night. After a couple of AU$2 rum & cokes we were rocking the night away with the friendly staff and met some people from far away places.

Been to Chiang Mai many times but had never visited this place before. Finally found it, and was amazed at the quality of the Musicians! As well as a normal week night, I attended the Open Jam Monday Night on two occasions. The standard was awesome, this wasn't some bad karaoke, rather talented muso's from around the World, who were in CM at the time. It was very busy, but the Service was fast and friendly, and beer prices very reasonable. Great Entertainment!

We stopped by to enjoy a beer with some live music and ended up staying all night! The quality of the bands that played were unbelievable!!! Cool setting too, overlooking the market. A nice change from the usual smokey basement that blues bars are usually found in.

If you like American blues you will love this place and Boy Blues Band. He is an excellent guitar player with style similar to Santana, Hendrix and Howling Wolf that he has made his own. A blues fan will be in heaven.

If you love blues and chilling with friends, this is the spot for you. It definitely offers top talent and the prices are great. Free entry and you just pay for your drinks while being entertained. I'll definitely be returning here, over and over! Great job guys!

We stumbled upon Boy Blues Bar whilst exploring the night Bazaar and were instantly mesmerized by the quality of music being played. Classic blues including epics like 'Voodoo Child' from Hendrix were being cranked out exceptionally well! We returned the next night for a bender and had the time of our lives! I recommend this place to everyone,great service and entertainment.

What a lovely evening! I was humming all the way back to the hotel! Boy Blues Bar is situated in the Kalare Night Bazaar on Changkuan Rd. After searching for a venue with live music & reading the reviews on TA, I made a note & we got to the bazaar at 18h30. Boy Blues only opens at 20h00 so we went & had a dinner at place literally below the bar. Very reasonably priced & good food. At 20h00 we went to the bar with the intention of having a few drinks only. We ended up staying till the end. They had 2 bands playing & a lady singer who did a few numbers. All were brilliant & you just cannot leave! What a great evening out! Do yourself a favour & make a point of going.

To be found on a central mezzanine floor in one of the night bazaars. Great live music from about 21.00. On average 3 bands a night. One normally contains Boy himself. Lead guitar & vocals. Monday is Jam Night. Never been disappointed. Some real characters from all over the world. If you love your blues/rock, you'll love this place. No food, but really reasonably priced drinks. Pay as you go. No tabs. Closed on Sundays.
A good blues and 60s pop cover band, while sipping some beerlao dark. The overall vibe at this place above the nightbazaar was great.

We had to search around for this as google maps was not helpful. It's actually inside the main night market pavilion. Saw 2 of the 3 bands playing - both excellent. Boy's band was fantastic- great mix of well known and some of their own numbers. Great guitar playing and keyboard player pretty awesome. Beer is reasonably priced and great atmosphere. A must if you're into blues and have time to spare when in Chiangmai.
Great live music,we went twice!both time 3 different bands high standard,.cheapish drinks but funny,uncomfable chairs.

Read some of the lower reviews and can see their point. Didn't have smoke problems as it wasn't too busy. The band was ok but not great singing and we sat on stools at the bar which looked the best option. The 4 of us were about to leave but lucky for us we stayed for 1 more beer and "Boy" turned up about 9pm with a different bass guitarist and drummer. Can only say they were absolutely fantastic and it was well worth the wait. "Boy" was the best guitarist I have heard ever and I'm getting on a bit! Looked like he lived for playing and his enjoyment spread through the bar. Also had a accompanying lady singer for some of the numbers and she was also very good. Not too easy to find but once in the market you can just follow the sounds to the upstairs bar. Go for it, you wont regret it!

I thoroughly enjoy going to the Boy Blues Bar because of the great music and interaction with the band. It has a nice, relaxed atmosphere and the service is good if a bit slow at times due to many customers.
Fantastic blues band who are obviously loving what they do, very talented, well worth A visit, excellent bar staff very attentive, no david lynch spotted though!

I'm from the south, so I know good blues. These guys that play at Boy Blues Bar SLAY. The music was great and the guys playing had a blast the whole night long. Their song choices were prime, featuring classics by Santana and The Eagles. The bar is in the center of the Night Bazaar; you'll hear them playing, trust me. The drinks were cheap and good, but the live entertainment was the real draw here. You know you'll be at the Night Bazaar, so why not stop in and check this place out?
Great music and atmosphere listening to Boy an d his band jamming in this cool bar. It's a fun location upstairs above the market.

I'm so glad that I saw this place on Trip Advisor, as it was definitely the best night out that we had in Thailand. My husband and I went on a Monday night when it was open mic night. The artists were great and the crowd was fun. I would definitely recommend this to everyone who is visiting Chiang Mai!
The boy played at his bar and it has been a blast! The crowd was cheering and beers are cheap. Was so nice!! Will come back soon.
If you love the blues you will love this bar,lovely staff and truly amazing talent.Great electricity but a nice place to chill with the locals.Boys band is not to be missed!

Fabulous location - raised up one floor in the Kalare shopping centre, it has great acoustics and the band is sublime. Jamming on a number of nights brings out the best of Chiang Mai's musicians. Just unbelievably good music, night after night.

I visited Boy Blues Bar by chance on a Monday evening. It is just a few steps above the night market and I could here live music. The cover band was ok but the singer needed to learn better pronunciation! However sitting at the bar with a Leo in hand I could see that something was about to happen as I noticed the diverse mixture of patrons now entering. I was lucky to be informed by a long tern expat that Monday nights are Jam Nights bringing a variety of musicians of all ages and cultures together t produce amazing music. It started with some solo artists, all of whom were excellent in their own rights but as the evening progressed the number of highly talented medications jamming together was a great pleasure to listen and watch. If you are in Chiang Mai on a Monday, don't miss but get there by 21:00 if you want a seat!
Great atmosphere, good live band music, calm and cosy place for a drink, too bad they dun serve food, but there is plenty places for foods around
Nice location, great musicians, friendly staff, good music, We spend some hrs there and enjoyed with all senses

This was my second trip to chaing mai and each time I have spent every evening at this bar. The music is great if you like blues but Boy who plays at least one spot every night is entertaining even if you aren't a big blues fan. This guy is as good as anything I have heard on the pub scene in UK if not better. Be warned he only knows one joke and he tells it every night! Still funny though
Awesome. Three bands tonight very competent with their own individual styles. Entrance hard to find in the bazaar. Just follow your ears , up stairs. well worth a visit. Lots of food close by.
Just go you won't regret it. We are back again in Chiang Mai in June and will be there. Drinks good price.

We had so much fun there that we went twice during our short visit to Chiang Mai. Great musicians and ambiance. Boy Blues is fantastic! Oddly enough everybody danced on Thursday night but no dancers Saturday night, however both nights were very enjoyable. No bathroom facilities or food in bar but they are only a short walk away. We got there just before 9 pm and had plenty of seats to choose from, it seemed most people arrived briefly after 9 and for larger groups tricky so seat in better areas to enjoy show but music is listened well from anywhere. Located Inside night market this place is not too miss. Staff is great too.

Ok, it is not Chicago nor NOLA, but it is still pretty good. The opening band is ok but around 10 o'clock Boy's band comes on and they can really play the blues. My wife and I went here twice and were impressed and entertained both times. The location is a bit odd but it still works. I highly recommend this place for a nice evening out away from the bar girl scene. I would,only recommend that the drinks be a little stronger and that there be better signage indicating where the great tunes are coming from.

I went with two colleagues after we had dinner out. We were delighted with the live band that played a good mix of blues and rock-and-roll. We enjoyed reasonably priced beverages and a fun crowd. There was a good mix of people including a family with small kids doing a little air band off to the side.
Fantastic atmosphere in this place - everything from AC/DC, Black Sabbath, Lynyrd Skynyrd, etc. played live every night. One of a kind in Thailand

Saw this place had good reviews and thought we would give it a try. We arrived 30 mins after opening. There wasn't much of a crowd but the band playing were talented and covering well known/not so well known rock songs. As the bands rotated, there were some American country singers, maybe making a last ditch attempt to make it in Thailand. Okay if you like that sort of thing. I wouldnt be fooled by the name of the bar- there wasn't a hint of blues music. At times it felt a little like slightly up market karaoke. As the crowd started to build, it was very apparent that this place attracts older white men with young Thai women. Some men arrived on their own and in no time, had a young Thai girl draped over them at the bar. Perhaps this is a pick up point for this sort of thing. I am not naive enough to think that this sort of culture isn't present in Thailand. We personally just found it a little uncomfortable at times as it was so prolific in this particular bar. Perhaps a certain clash in cultures and valuing women's rights etc made us feel this way. I think if you are expecting it and are more comfortable with the Thai bride/ sex trafficking side of things then this would be less of an issue. Mixed feelings about this place. More due to the clientele than the bar itself, although the music wasn't always great either. Maybe it was just the particular night we went (Monday)

If you look for something special in the nightlife of Chiang Mai and you like old style western music this the place to go, especially when Boy "Hendrix" is live on stage performing the blues. Now in low season you will find some expat farangs and a bunch of travellers. Nice mood and fair prices for the beer and drinks.

Literally searched for this place for 1 hour around the night bazaar area. Impossible to find but worth it. Truly the best blues I've heard in a long time. Unfortunately they played the same songs when I eagerly returned the following day. CHANGE IT UP! Don't miss the first slot around 8pm, he is amazing!!! Directions - walk along the night bazaar road, into the the Kalare Food Market and use your ears to follow the music up to the rooftop bar.

We had a great night here last night. No entry fee, well priced drinks and three good bands. Too easy. I love the blues. The players obviously love the blues, too. The feel for the music was convincing and the guys can really play! I don't know his name but the lead guitar/vocalist in the second band has the best shtick since Buddy Guy. Entertaining, and you have to be really good to get away with it. I went to sleep last night with great music running through my head.
Totally by accident stumble upon. The band are fantastic and cater for all requests for a few baht in the tip box. The singer has an infectious smile, Thai Jimmy Hendrix for sure.
blues n beer. easy beer joint on the second level of the market eateries and shops. harps blues and guitar blues and blues vocals. chuck berry to bb king. all things blues ...

It doesn't get going till about 10 pm , but it has all the best blues/rock bands and musicians of Chiang Mai playing through the week as well as touring blues musicians and Bangkok players and a jam night where anyone can get up or join in . A great range of acts .

This venue is top class. The music filters through the Chiang Mai night market and we were wondering where it was coming from. We eventually found the bar and this was definitely *the* highlight of our visit to Chiang Mai. Boy and his band were a clear highlight of the evening. But the other bands playing were equally talented and noteworthy. Its free to watch, obviously you pay for the performance through the drinks. I took some videos so you can get an idea of their skill: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hfn9iRc8BUY https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gtC9w1sojNg https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1a_8UqWW2mY

Fabulous live music, drinks not too expensive and the best atmosphere we have found in Chiang Mai. We had the pleasure of hearing Boy play too as the band were a guitarist short and WOW! Definitely not a place to miss and a perfect escape from the market after a spending spree!

Go to the Night Bazaar and find this small, tucked away venue. You have to go up some stairs to find it but you can hear the great music as you come up to it. The man with the wild grey hair, who I think might be "boy" is so fun to watch, on and off the stage and clearly loves what he does. Musicians from America, UK and Australia came to noodle, as well as fantastic Thai musicians. Whether it's experienced blues players or young musicians working out material, all seem welcome and it is a pleasure to see these people work on what they love. A must see for any blues, classic rock, rock n roll, folk or psychedelic fans.

Arriving as the warm up band was doing their sound checks, I was sorry to leave four hours later after the house band had been performing for a while. From blues standards to Bob Dylan to Pink Floyd, the musicianship of the band members was incredible. If you enjoy live blues and tasty rock and roll, don't miss Boy Blues Bar! It's in the middle of a night market area just off the main road but after 7:00-7:30-ish when the sound checks have started, you should have no trouble finding the stairs up. It's a small venue but the staff is attentive in spite of the distraction of some great, live music. If you like the sweet sounds of a Fender Strat or the growl of Gibson guitar, check out Boy Blues Bar!

Boy Blus Bar att Night Baazar Chiangmai 1.st floor open 8 pm - 12pm tuesd-sat Nice live Music.Different bands all nights, some better then others but atmosphere is realy cosy and it is blues mixed with other popular songs Music, When you go inside Night Baazar at 8 pm you only look up to first floor and follow the sound, You cant miss it. -There is a small stairway leading up to the bar (small with tables and chairs where they serve you directly from the bar) dont forget to give the musicians an small tip in the small box infront of them) If you have a request of a special song/tune -just ask them, If they now it they will play it for you ! -But then not forget the tip in box

I was actually just looking for a place to sit and relax for a minute, but ended up staying all evening. Awesome place! Location is great, prices are fair and the service is good. Saw two acts performing, the last one was the owner Boy who really knows how to entertain! I think no one could help but smile whenever he did - which was pretty much all the time. So don't miss out on Boy Blues Bar if you're in Chiang Mai, you'll be guaranteed a really good time!

Boy Blues Bar is easy to miss if you don’t know what you’re looking for… it’s above one of the shops in the Kalare Market (one of the covered sections of the night market, north of the intersection with McDonalds and Starbucks). It’s very close to the boxing ring and the restaurant that has seating like a food court. Of course, once you get close just follow the sound of live blues to the staircase that leads up to the bar. Like many Thai bars, there is live music by local artists covering western songs. The opening act plays the same (good) set every night. That’s where this bar suddenly changes from the normal Thai mold. The owner (?) of the bar is a real character, and he starts to play at about 9 or so most nights. His talent (and that of his band) is that they play blues the way blues is meant to be played: from the heart, not from the songbook. He starts a song by playing enough of a riff for the drummer and bassist to come in, then off they go with whatever the feel like. All three are top-notch players, and they work together really well. You’ll know it’s them because the guitarist has the most amazing facial expressions (smiles, goofy grins, looks of surprise, etc) that are perfect punctuation to the music. And on Monday nights at about 9pm the jam session starts. Musicians from all around the world who are working and living in Chiang Mai gather and put on a great blues/rock session until midnight or so. There are a couple players who are absolutely fantastic, and several more who are good in their own right but do very well as part of the jam. Get your food at the aforementioned restaurant and bring it upstairs with you… it’s a great place to listen to live music, eat a late meal, and talk with expats for a while to get your western culture fix in the middle of your vacation.

This bar is a 'must visit' if you are in Chiang Mai and enjoy good music, and a great atmosphere. It has become our regular weekend nightspot, and well worth the effort of getting to the Night Bazaar area. Always a mixture of locals and visitors being entertained by Boy and the band. And quite often other visiting musicians will join them..!
Was there for open mike night and was surprised at the good quality of Ex-pat talent! Good time with reasonably priced drinks.

As others has also mentioned, this isn't a strict "blues only" kinda place, but its nonetheless one of the greatest musical nights of my life. It's not that easy to find, but if you go to Kalare night bazaar and ask around, then you'll surely find it. In the last two nights me and my girlfriend has spent a total of 7.5 hours at the bar, just soaking up the music, and admiring the great musicians. Bottom line: If you are a fan of guitar-heavy, blues-oriented music, then this is the place to be!
Visited several time and saw a fantastic variety of bands, vibrant atmosphere with friendly staff. Open mike night on a Monday.

It is upstairs in a Night Bazzar market, beers and great live music. really enjoyed the band between 11:00pm-12:00am, they said they only play on Thursdays and Fridays, and we went back for two nights, had so much fun !

I went here thinking of, how does Thailand an blues mix? Was very pleasantly suprised! The band playing was really good and Nice locations. If you're in Chiang Mai and like blues you should og to this Place.

I was walking through the shopping area and heard some good blues music. I wasn't entirely sure whether it was live or recorded... but I was pretty sure it sounded live. I eventually realised the music was from a bar upstairs and went up to check it out. I spent the rest of the night in there, I was pleasantly surprised to see how talented the band was, the play the blues extremely well. The lead guitarist is fantastic, but would be nothing without his drummer or bass guitarist. Worth the visit.

We lived in Chiangmai for the past year and went to hear Boy and his band quite often. We love the place and the music. Boy is so engaging with his band and with the crowd. It is a fun place to listen to really good music. Not a huge beer selection, but if your looking for good jazz, this is your place. You will want to go back, again and again.

Owner and guitarist Boy has recently re-located to this covered open-air roof terrace bar in the heart of the Kalare Night Bazaar, off Changklan Road. Boy is the cousin of the famous "Took" who owns The Brasserie, and is renowned as one of South East Asia's best guitarists. It certainly runs in the family, as Boy makes his guitar sweetly sing six nights a week (closed on Sundays). Drinks are reasonably priced. No cover charge. Smoking is allowed (although I am not a smoker, to me a blues bar without smoke is like an orchestra without a cello) but the premises are open air so ventilated well. After a night shopping in the night bazaar, a perfect place to end up for a few drinks and a healthy dose of blues!
Went there with a friend I just met. Boy and his band were very good, good blues, talented musicians, cool micro rooftop atmosphere, peeps got up and danced. Fun night out

Myself and my friend are in Chiang Mai for three nights and we stumbled upon this place after hearing the music. We were the first people in the bar this evening but it soon started to fill up. All I can say is it was one of the most enjoyable nights of our lives, the music was absolutely fantastic. Such talented players and so charismatic, especially Boy who had me cracking up so many times because he just seemed to enjoy what he was doing so much. If you love good music in a relaxed atmosphere with reasonable drink prices you will love this place. We are going back again tonight because we enjoyed it so much.

Went here a few years ago and forgot that I had been here until going through my holiday photo's recently! This band is amazing and really worth checking out if you love live music! Had a great time at this bar and will definitely head back the next time I visit Chiang Mai!
great unexpected music and bar above night market. don't be confused by the title of the venue. Whoever is getting the bands in here knows how to pick serious good emerging talent.

I would go back to Chiang Mai just to be at the Boy Blues Bar. I am not even a blues lover but I had an amazing time. The musicians there play some fantastic music and its such a joy to watch and listen! Its a blues bar - you drink and enjoy the music. Eat and then go as you would not want to step out before midnight that is when they close.
Great atmosphere and completely packed. Reasonable priced drinks and lots of seating area. This bar is a hidden gem. 10/10 would reccommend.

Awesome blues band. Lead guitarist and vocalist “Boy” (younger cousin of the legendary blues musician “Took”) has been referred to as an amazing reincarnation of Jimi Hendrix/Eric Clapton. Having seen Hendrix live in the late 60s, I can tell you that Boy's rendition of “Little Wing” and “All Along the Watch Tower” are comparable to the great Jimi and just as good or better than versions by Stevie Ray Vaughn, Jeff Beck and other Hendrix successors. Tucked up a stairway in the eaves of the Kalare Night Market section of the Chiang Mai Night Bazaar in an indoor/outdoor loft space, Boy Blues Bar is run by Boy and Claire, an English singer from Kent who is super nice and friendly. Claire sometimes joins the band with her unique voice and stage presence, which is a special treat. The first set is played by rotating bands, followed by fabulous blues from “Boy Blues Band.” Monday night is jam night, when local musicians add saxes, trumpets, and guest singers to the mix. Highly recommended. Great guitarist, fabulous feeling for the blues, my favorite place in all of S.E. Asia to chill out and listen to live music.

I am not exactly a fan of blues music but I recognized the level of skills required to be a blues musician. Boy Blues Bar has a very simple set up of benches, modest bar and small tables and chairs. The simplicity is more than compensated by the sophistication of their guitarist, bassist and drummer skillfully handling their music instruments to mesmerize the patrons. One of the best pub live bands I had ever seen. Recommended

We followed the music to this bar in the middle of the night market and were pleasantly surprised. Staff was prompt and attentive. The professional band who started the Monday night open mic night were really good (although I personally would have preferred less Pink Floyd and more traditional blues). The lead guitarist was awesome, with a clear, clean sound. We will go back again.
Located just at the middle of kalare night bazaar. you will just hear the music when you are walking by. I don't know what kind of music they are on but it's awesome and I love it!!

Up the stairs in the Chiang Mai Night Bazaar is a enjoyable venue for music lovers. It usually begins at 9:00 pm and goes until midnight. There is no admission fee and the drinks are reasonable. .Monday night is open mike night, I believe, so go and have fun. I suggest arriving a little early to get a good seat as they go fast. Boy Blue is the owner and a good guitarist.

When it's great here it really is great. When Boy is playing the night is always fantastic. Definitely worth visiting. Can be a bit hard to find. The bar is on top of the market. Listen for the music and look for the staircase.
We followed our ears up to the rooftop bar within the night market area. Good place to relax after so much walking!! Good music, friendly staff, reasonably priced drinks.

Popped in fairly late at night for a beer or two and to hear the house band, which I'd heard was great. Was not disappointed. The crowd in was very small this evening, but the band was excellent. They had so much fun playing together, and related well to the audience, as well as being great musicians in the blues genre. Can highly recommend finding this place for some great music.

a sense of achievement upon finding it, pat yourself on the back when you do. It's in the Kalare ? indoor market -just wander around in circles for about 30 mins looking for a small yellow sign near a small flight of stairs and you'll find it. You don't hear the music until you're there. Once upstairs get a drink, sit down and enjoy the blues while watching the stall holders below pack up for the day. Nice little spot -if you can find it !

It seems an unusual place to find a decent blues bar, tucked up in the eaves of the night bazaar, but Boy Blues Bar is a great place to chill out with a few beers and listen to blues music. The bar is run by a very nice couple, Thai musician, Boy, and his wife from Kent, 6 days a week, Boy and his Blues Band play each evening from around 8pm to midnight. They also have occasional guest musicians and jam nights. At 100 BHT for a large bottle of Chang or Leo, beer is cheap and flows freely. If you are in Chiang Mai, I would highly reccomend this place for an evening out.

I was there on a Tuesday night and saw Boy's band playing the blues, followed by a disco cover band playing hits like Dancing Queen and YMCA. It was great music and very joyful! A third of the crowd ended up on their feet and dancing by the end. There's was a family there with a young girl (maybe 8 years old?) and she received nothing but smiles from the performers and staff. This is a great, chill, and joyful place.

We were contemplating another night of muay thai kickboxing when we heard what sounded like some pretty cool live music playing somewhere in the distance. A quick "heads or temples" toss of the coin decided that it was a live music night tonight for us! We can be terribly indecisive at times and often rely on the coin. Anyway, we followed our ears and a short walk later stumbled upon the raddest little rooftop venue, right near the night bazaar, where the reincarnated Jimmy Hendrix was shredding out blues licks in a way that made me think I had found the source of global warming. Needless to say, several beers were consumed, followed by several more. And then came the dancing..... Everyone in the place (who wasn't dancing) was head nodding and grooving away in there seats, utterly enthralled by Boy and his rocking blues band. Honestly, I don't think I've seen a tighter blues band than these guys in years, and boy can Boy play! I couldn't recommend this place more if you are into live music and even more so if you love blues music like us! The music was pumping, the service friendly (especially if you tip the waitresses!) and the atmosphere was electric (pardon the pun)! Go there, you won't regret it.

Like others, we came across this place by accident and what a great place it is. If you enjoy hearing really good live music from talented musicians then this is the place to go. It is quite difficult to find the entrance up to the venue but don't give up! Price of drinks is reasonable and a good night is guaranteed, so go along and support this great hidden gem.
This place is amazing!! We stumbled across it by pure chance & were quite content to stay there for the night!!! Good drink, atmosphere & music!!

Boy is a lovely guy who plays a mean guitar. His band is on every night and play some fantastic blues. People are welcome to jam and the atmosphere is friendly. The chairs look liek they came from a kindergarten and are a bit uncomfortable, but the drink prices are reasonable and overall, it's a cool little place. Check it out.

Arrive after 8pm and it gets super busy quickly, as that is when the bands start. Arrive after 9pm you may not get a seat. Not all blues, it is an ecletic mix of classic and soft rock, reggae and blues all thrown together. Really friendly vibe, comfy seats and reasonably priced drinks. No wifi and no toilet (you have to use the market) and some repetition of popular songs (Wonderful tonight was played by two different bands) are the only negatives for me. If, like me, you find Thai music a little cheesy and irritating, you will find this a breath of fresh air!
Need to get there early as the bar packs up around 8pm, inside the Night Bazaar close to all the restaurants etc good place to have a few drinks and listen to the music
Its when the open mic session happens. Unbelievably good spontaneous music in a chilled atmosphere. Great place for some good blues, a few drinks and some chats !

This oasis of calm above the bustle of the Chian Mai night market is well worth checking out during or after your shopping. It's free entry (cash bar -reasonable prices) and the music is fantastic. Boy's guitar playing was fabulous and the rest of the band were pretty cool too. Reminded me of a cross between Jimi Hendrix & Eric Clapton.

Love this place! Boy is a treasure with his uncle stopping by once in awhile "Took" to rock out! Saturday night is my favorite time to go and watch the magic! Beer is cold and well priced. Water and coke for the non-drinkers is cheap! The place can get packed!
Hands down the best blues spot in Chiang Mai. Seriously talented musicians here. The overall atmosphere is laid back and 'groovy'!
Best live blues music in town. Don"t forget to bring a pick on monday, it"s a jam night.
good place to go in Chiang Mai lay back have a drink and just love it. was there and went most nights .the place gets going and the blues flow . great people and wonderful no real bar presser .

Visited this bar with friends for the second time in 4 years. The staff were again friendly and accommodating. Drinks were reasonably priced and staff were attentive to our needs. The music was loud enough to be heard but not too loud to prevent some conversation. The musicians were extremely good and the music chosen was eclectic, though little of it (at the time of visit) met the genre of 'blues' - unless 'Another Brick in The Wall' is classed as 'blues'? Having said that, and not meaning to be too picky, it was a great place to chill listening to accomplished musicians provide both Thai and English songs. The resident band led by 'Boy' was brilliant. Highly Recommended!

Went to the night bazaar with a local expat friend and he took us to Boy Blues Bar. Great little upstairs balcony bar with great music! Boy was really good on the guitar and entertaining. You could tell he was genuinely friendly and always smiling and interacting with everyone there. Beer is decently priced as well.

About two years ago we discovered Boy Blues Bar located in the Kalare Nightmarket crossways abobe Sila-Aat Restaurant. Actually, our back then 3 year old daughter discovered the place by hearing the live music. She wanted to visit the 'party', so we went up the stairs. We had a great time. Good bands, good music and if you are in luck, you will hear Boy play himself. Very good atmosphere and Boy is just so much fun watching him play. We ended up there 4 nights out of 5 we stayed in Chiang Mai and this year we went back. If you are in Chiang Mai you just pay Boy a visit and find out for yourself. This year he played the friday an saturday night round 21:30. Have fun!

I am not by any means a music fan, but this was a knockout. I swear I wandered back in my mind to the 60's and 70's. The musicians here are amazing. The crowd seemed to be made up of some serious muso's so I am sure this is A One quality. The amazing thing is its in the night market up a set of stairs and kinda hard to find. If this was a major city there would be a line outside waiting to get in. As I said, just go!

Boy Blues band starts playing 9.45pm, 6 evenings a week (not Sundays). Drink prices very fair, 110baht for large leo. Music great, most seats a bit uncomfortable. Find it in night bazaar by entering Kalare Market at zebra crossing, up steps to mezzanine floor. 3 regular players, guitar, bass guitar, drums, gel brilliantly to produce great blues. Augmented often by other excellent musicians, notably keyboard on Fridays, a haunting bass? sax, a harmonica/singer, a powerful lady blues singer and an entertaining guy coming. Don't miss this place.

We stumbled upon this bar when visiting the night market. The band playing various blues and rock songs were really great. The vocals were somewhat different, but still very good. The service was friendly and effecient. Get there early to get seating. A must visit.

We were walking though the night market when we heard some really good music playing - intrigued we sought out the source and discovered the stairs up to Boy Blues Bar, I had read it had good reviews so we went up. It was pretty packed in the bar but luckily they made some room for us near the front! Rock, blues and all that sort of thing isn't really our cup of tea but you couldn't help but be impressed with the band playing, as they were really enjoying themselves and so were the crowd. The singer they had on was really good too and we really enjoyed ourselves. This is a great place to have a drink as the music is guaranteed to get your toe tapping. Boy is very charismatic too so you'll enjoy just watching him jam.

Great place for some genuine live Blues and Rock from the seventies and beyond. Mixed crowd from young till elderly. A special jam session every Monday, quite an experience ;-) Boy is the soul of the place and he knows how to engage the crowd, nice lad. Located near Night Bazaar on a roof top terrace it's an awfully cool and pleasant place. Reasonable priced drinks available. You better check it out ;-)
Great place on Monday night to view local talent. Inside the Night market. Great music venue in Chiang Mai
Great music, rooftop with a breeze, and yet covered from the rain! You can have all this and more at Boy Blues. :-) Great venue for live music in a lively part of town. Always a good choice.

Yesterday I had been to the best concert since 10 years, and I have been to many. After having been to the Boy Blues Bar last Saturday night already, I came here the second time now at about nine o'clock, heard a very good group playing until a quarter to ten, and then I was blown my mind. That's why I came there, and I will come there again and again. Great place and a fantastic band called Boy Blues Band. The bass guitarist is absolutely stunning, absolutely brilliant, and to see WHERE he is picking the strings..., oh my goodness. My fingertips would be bleeding. He's even playing chords and flageolets on his bass guitar and the quickest quavers I ever heard on bass guitar. The drummer is, this is the first impression only, unobtrusive but he is absolutely versatile and absolutely versed and, as the bass guitarist does, keeps the band grooving, and he's still so young. And Boy on electric guitar is - how to put into words what I saw and heard - exceptional. He is in a class of his own and one of the best guitar players I ever heard, and I heard many the last 50 years. He is absolutely authentic and a very likeable musician with tremendous charisma and endowed with a voice which was made to sing the blues. These three guys know very well how to create the vibes with their audience, and they love to create those vibes with their audience. The good news is: the audience does not mind at all. Do I have to say that Boy creates amazing sounds, he and his guitar and his small amp, no pedals, no electronical tricks...!!! He and his guitar and his amp create his sounds. There's no technical gimmicks, there's "only" Boy's artistry and virtuosity. Quite often I got the idea - the idea was slipping into my mind yesterday - that Peter Green who had been an outstanding musician would love Boy's music and the way the band is reinterpreting the standards and, moreover, the way the band is able to make a sparkling pearl even out of a simple song. These three guys are awesome. Groovy music. Great music. Really great music. Super-fine blues music. Boy Blues Bar is the spot where they never let you down when you want to listen to the blues and when you are longing to feel the blues, and if you bring the blues along with you in the evening, climbing up the staircase, you have to know that these three guys make you feel much better within a few minutes. They share your blues, and amazingly enough, you will no longer want to get rid of your blues. What's more: nice and very relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff, good beers and beverages, fair prices. What a lovely place! Who said blues is founded on cotton-fields... I got wise and I'd say blues is flourishing and blossoming and blooming and being in flower on rice-fields as well. Equally well or maybe even better. And isn't Lan Na "the land of the thousand rice-fields"? In few words: Boy Blues Bar is absolutely a must for everybody who is coming to Chiang Mai. It is even one more good reason to come to Chiang Mai. No, it is a reason on its own to come here to CM and hear the Boy Blues Band play.
So much fun. Boy is super chill and loves interacting with the audience. He's got a great voice. Also the bar is located inside the night market so it is a perfect spot.

Checked out this place our first night in Chiang Mai & LOVED IT! Finding it-looking at the food court inside the Night Market, the stairwell is to the right & leads you up to the 2nd floor covered space. Venue itself is small & intimate (but open air) & all centered towards the stage. This isn't a place to talk with friends, it's a space to just sit back & enjoy the great music. Highly recommend this bar if you're visiting the city.
A perfect place to escape the chaos and to chill, relax and enoy the music with some drinks. If the ladies will smile a bit more this is definitely a 5 star
We were a little bit early but no matter, because we enjoyed the music so much. The drinks was ok, we stayed til late and had a really nice time

You might have a bit of trouble finding this place. It is tucked away INSIDE of a shopping complex on the second floor. The street it is on is at the north end of the nighttime walking street market. On the right hand side of the street as you walk north. Never heard anything less than good music there. Sometimes the music is superb. Especially if Tuk and his friends are playing. Nice laid back place in an open air environment.

Some find it a difficult place to get to, but really once you find Kalare Night Bazaar just go inside and look for a small square building inside the bazaar itself, with white fencing around the top. That is Boy Blues Bar! The name comes from Boy, the owner and master rhythm guitar player. He and his band play most nights if he isn’t traveling or teaching the young musicians of Chiang Mai, and there’s usually a 2nd band each night as well. The music is not unexpectedly blues and soul but Saturday night there is a fantastic 7-piece band that plays funky 70s and 80s sounds and they are brilliant! Monday or Tuesday (can’t remember which) is jam night where anyone with any talent can get up and play, or sing. You’d be surprised at the amount of musicians traveling through CM who find their way to BBB! Drinks are reasonably priced considering there is no entrance fee but please, if you do go buy a drink each eh? Seeing two or three folk sharing one beer is a bit sad and detrimental to everyone. There is no food option but the night bazaar and adjacent streets have plenty, and the toilets are downstairs and in a different block, but there are clean and well maintained. Would I recommend Boy, his bar and his music? Wholeheartedly!
Was ok - music great, bar prices very high - especially as there is no roof so you can listen to music from food court downstairs at 2/3 price for beers....seems very odd
A re-discovery of blues music. Boy's fingers worked magic on his guitar. Monday night was a phenomena. Made me imagined I was at a blues concert.

Oh Chiang Mai!, I never imagined that i would ind so many talent musicians at one place, its almost impossible to say how happy and grateful i am to spend some nights there. The service is really good, everyone is lovely and i recommend with my eyes closed, its not hard too find, on the top of the Nigh bazar Kalare, you just follow the good music and you are there. Boy, the owner plays there and is tremendous hostess beyond a great musician.

A previous reviewer spoke of limited live music venues in Chiang Mai. This is actually inaccurate. There's live music to be found all over the place, including many spots in Niemanhaemin. On the basis of only one hour's listeniing to date, having arrived at the end of the evenng, I'd venture to say Boy Blues Bar is the best. Performing when I arrived was a slender Auatralian lady whose looks were entirely belied by the stunniing powerful Blues voice across a range of registers as she assured us she had her Mojo working. She clearly revelled in the music whch made her performance all the more infectious. When she sat down she showed a similar and really genuine appreciation of the musicians who replaced her. Who were all quite excellent: two great guitarists, lead and bass, a singer and another singer who blew up a storm on harmonica. It was exciting, satisfying stuff and I'll be back in the next few days, making sure to arrive much earlier.

We popped in here for a couple of hours, and it was a heap of fun. The band is very talented and quite interactive. The bar itself was a lot different than I had imagined, it is a mezzanine/roof top floor above some shops...no real room to dance, but more sit back and relax and enjoy the music. It is also a great place to people watch, there were a number of very funny things that happened while we were there :)

nice music, not to crowdy. they were really nice and after 2 hours of walking in the bezzar, it was perfect to feel the air from the rooftop of the building. clean and fresh breaz with good music and nice people, what more do you ask for?
Atmosphere is relax with alcohic drinks, served and great jazz, blues and rock... Great band... Good and relaxing at the roof top... Windy day... But food needs to be ordered from downstairs

My first night here was a Monday, which is jamming night. It was one of the best nights of live music I've been to. Tourists from around the world had brought their guitars etc. and everyone was just in the zone. The quality of the musicians and singers was excellent and it had a bit of a free and experimental feel that got the crowd going - how a jam should be. Boy played as well and it was clear to see how much he loved having others do their thing in his bar. Boy is super-friendly and always smiling and plays some great stuff. Some nights are quiter, but still enjoyable to chill out with a few cold beers and talk, then listen to some great tunes. I really like the location of the bar: it's up some stairs in an open-air setting (but is protected from rain), and you hear the music when walking in from the night-market. Looking forward to visiting again!

Treat yourself to a night out at Boy Blues Bar - upstairs in the Kalare Night Bazaar (just listen out for the music). Not the most comfortable bar around, but boy, the music and friendliness of the place makes up for the slightly sore bum. I make a point of including at least 1 visit to Boy's bar every time I visit Chiang Mai. Drink prices are reasonable - and the line-up of muso's is of the highest standard. It's full of life after 10pm and even if you are not a lover of blues music, you'll love the fun and atmosphere . . . and some of the very surprising musicians. Check it out. You'll love it.
Chiang Mai has many live music venues, this is surely the best!! Superb musicians, very engaging, lots of fun. If you want an unforgettable evening, go here!
This bar offered a very different scene from most others in Chiang Mai. On a rooftop with live music it definitely was a cool place to hang out and grab a couple beers.

If you want to have a few drinks with great music go to BOY BLUES BAR!! The music was GREAT and the scene was really happening. Thai musicians playing awesome music with a cool vibe. I loved the place as a solo traveler.

We were thrilled to stumble upon the 'Boy Blues Bar', which was near to our hotel and in a great place on the top of the night bazaar and food court-open to the sky but with a roof like a gazebo. 'Boy' is obviously a blues fanatic, has his 'house' band, invited guests and also impromptu musicians getting up to jam with him. There is not a huge selection of drinks at the bar, but a reasonable red wine, the usual beers [Singha, Chang, Leo] and some spirits. There is some basic seating arranged in a semi circle facing the stage area. It was quite well attended on each night we went, with the 'jam' night very busy indeed. The music was very good, On our last night there was a trumpet and a sax player. It was all a most pleasant surprise and a fantastic addition to our week in Chiang Mai!

The music was great and the setting is fun so I would certainly recommend this. We did not stay too long as my partner is a white wine drinker and they simply don't have it on the menu. Local ablution facilities were bad.

This is just a nice place to be. The people are nice and the music is very good. It is up the stairs at Kalare, but open to the outdoors. On special occasions, you can see the fireworks and balloons going up too. Boy and his band play most nights, but there are guest players too. Monday is jam night and terrific.

After reading so many positive review I had to go and see for my self. Place is well located in the middle of a huge market. All sorts of things can be easily found. The bar is very small and in the open air. Music was great. Two bands played while I was there and both were really talented... If I can I will go again for sure Recommended

Our first time in Chiang Mai & our local friends suggested stopping by after the Yee Peng for some good music. These guys can really rock the blues, and just happened to be Monday so I was allowed to sit in on guitar for a couple of tunes. What fun! Thanks so much guys - you rock!!!
A great place to have a beer and listen to various groups play their version of rock & blues based music. It was a Monday night but was still pumping - well worth the crazy Tuk tuk ride!
Good music, reasonably priced beer and a relaxed amazing atmosphere. Come here for one drink as a break from the market or stay the whole night like we did - it's a real gem!
Great music, friendly staff. Went on a Monday night for open mic night. Super packed! Get there early if you want to get a seat.
Nice friendly atmosphere, good music and reasonable prices make this bar a nice place to hang out for a few easy drinks.

Great vibe once the night 'kicks in' and the bands start playing, open stage etc!! Boy plays and sings in his own band ('Boy Blues' wudya belive it?!) and is a fantastic lead guitarist who plays with amazing character and clear passion!! Been there a few times, and previous to that I used to go see Boy Blues play at the, sadly now defunct, 'Guitar Man' in CM! Excellent stuff and centrally located 'upstairs' within Kalare Food Court/ Night Bazaar area.

We discovered this place on day one of our stay in Chiang Mai after hearing some rock classics coming from a live band on top of a roof in the night bazaar. If you are looking for somewhere to just have a nice chilled out beer with some live music go there either just after 9 as the changeover of bands is at 9 or just after 8. Some great music played and will take you back home briefly even if you don't want to be taken back. We could have chilled there for hours listening to some great music looking over the night bazaar. Definitely go if you want to relax and listen to some old (for me) rock songs and chill. Couldn't fault the bands.

What a gem. My girlfriend and I were drawn towards Boy Blues Bar by the quality of music we could hear whilst shopping in the Night Market. I am so glad we found it as we were treated to a good night of quality music from Boy and his band. The atmosphere is so good it is easy to forget the busy Night Market outside. Returned a few times and always enjoyed it. Only down point is the long walk to the public toilets!

Like every other reviewer we found Boy Blues Bar by accident! Have a meal off the night bazaar and listen for the blues. Up the stairs and into the coolest; most mellow spot in all of Chiang Mai. Monday night is jam night. If you're going to go just once this may be the night to head for. Though going once is seldom an option!

Cracking little upstairs live music venue in Night Bazaar. Good mix of blues, rock etc. Enthusiastic and accomplished musicians. Good, friendly staff and fair prices for a live venue. Only downside was having to leave the bar down to public toilets.
Boy Blues Bar is one of my favorite music venues in Chiang Mai. Everyone there is friendly and real, and the ambiance is always nice.

As a dancer traveling the world listening to bands its so nice to sit in a warm open air bar listening to a fantastic blues band. Boy Blues Bar really offers this. Located upstairs in the markets you can hear the music everywhere. This is really where blues is, just chilling out with some beers and a blues band. The band was really really good, second night they had guest trumpeter and sax which just make it better. Would recommend having a beverage here anytime.

I had just returned from there, the place is on a roof in the center of the night market. Nice Bar, but the attraction is the blues band, they are super professional, making great music. If you are a music fan, go there, you will not regret!
Once inside Kalare night market, just follow the sound, it's upstairs. Good music, good fun and reasonable priced drinks.
This place is a little spot of heaven above a bustling market. The band were very talented and everyone was super happy. I will definitely visit again, fully recommend to anyone visiting chiang mai.

It's surreal to hear western song covers by ppl who may not be the best at English in the middle of a market. The bar is elevated and a little hard to find. Follow the music. Awesome, chill place with a slightly older crowd.

Was taken by friends for open mike night (every Monday). All I can say is it was superb! Visited twice - line up changes each week but there are regular performers. You wont be disappointed - a great night out!
Nice Thai blues bar above the Kalare Night Market. These guys can play! Google says the also serve cocktails, but it’s only beer and liquors here.

Whenever I am in Chiang Mai you can't miss Boys Blues Bar down in the Kalare Centre in the Nightbazzar. Quite hard to find but if you hear fabulous blues music just follow it up the stairs to the bar. GPS co-ords are 18°47'6.16"N, 99° 0'3.37"E Check out the clips on Youtube to see how good this band really is. Some nights the entire bar will be up rocking including many of the older tourists, especially when the Auzzie soul and blues singer is there who sounds like Janis Joplin. Great bar service too and the drinks are very cheap. Don't miss it best entertainment in town, and it's free while you are buying drinks.

Went there two nights in a row, every time the band is very good, nice personal, decent prices. Both got to meet boy, got a signed shirt and was the best! You can go there with friends or just alone doesn’t matter, its still it’s still worth going there. A must if visiting Chiang Mai!
If your in Chiang Mai you have to visit this bar. Awesome atmosphere, staff n music. Open mic on monday nights is a great show...
Great little, old fashioned, music gem. Good vibes and a useful "crèche" for non - shopping lovers in a busy market !
surprise to find some great music with some good old boys i saw from the US, Australia playing some good tunes

We saw the reviews of the bar on TripAdvisor, but the location when arriving there didn't convince us at the beginning. But looking for an escape from a rainstorm we gave it a try. After going up the stairs to this little bar situated in a bazar we stayed here till the end. That night was open mic, so we witnessed a lot of undiscovered talent in the room. The atmosphere was amazing and the music very entertaining. Don't miss this experience when travelling to Chiang Mai.

I went for Monday jam night and it was a bit disappointing. The level of musicianship wasn't great and since the bar is semi-open, when it started raining, everyone got wet :( I went back the next day and the music from the house band was much better. Boy is a lovely guy and while the bar is a bit rough around the edges, it has a laid-back and comfortable ambience.

We came across Boy Blues Bar via our hotel recommendation. We were really pleased we got there about 9pm because we were still lucky enough to get a but Any later and you will probably have to stand. We had a very good time here, The atmosphere was great and drinks were reasonably priced. If we ever come back to Chiang Mai we will certainly come back again. Ps Monday is open mic night- so much fun! Anyone is welcome, Boy the owner encourages anyone and everyone to join in and have a good time.

My wife and I went here almost every night we were in Chiang Mai. If you like the blues, you'll love this place. It's located in the night bazaar so you can grab some boiled chicken before going to make a good crash pad for the booze you'll be inspired to throw back here. Very inviting for visiting "farang" as you will see a lot of westerners here.

i was in the Kalare market and heard live music being played. i found the Boy Blues bar, and went in for a look. it was a Monday, which i found out was open mike night, so many local musiciand show up to play. i love listening to live bands, and was impressed with the quality of music. one of the guitar players and a drummer was wxcellent, played some older songs by the Allman Brothers, Eric Clapton. also played some more pop type songs, but all were good.. the crowd seems to be a mix of older local expats as well as tourists that wandered in after visiting the Night Bazaar. i will definitely return,

Talented musicians play every night in this hidden open air bar upstairs, inside the bazaar. Great amosphere and drinks just keep on coming by the staff. Seems to get busy by 9 or 10pm so be earlier for a seat. If you are into live bands this place is a MUST to listen to the talent.

What a surprise to find a blues bar in Chiang Mai and musicians who appear to have honed their craft over several years. A little different to hear some notable tunes sung in Thai; left you playing 'name that tune'. Not all blues but a nice variety of music. And at a volume where you didn't have to scream at your buddy to chat with them. You just gotta stop by for a listen and a beer! Sure glad we found it.

This is the perfect place if you're looking for a chill setting to listen to some really good music over a few drinks. The musicians are extremely talented and know how to entertain their audience. Definitely check it out!
Monday night is jamming night. So well worth coming then. The music is good and the prices are ok. 80b for a small Singha. If you like music - and especially the blues - don't miss it.
Spent two fantastic nights here! We were all blown away by the amazing talent we saw and heard!! Could have stayed for hours and hours! A must if you want a really cool evening!! X

Near Night Bazaar in covered market on mezzanine floor one level up. Don't miss out on this bar if you are visiting Chiang Mai., Brilliant blues band, great music and atmosphere. Also good service from bar, prices OK. Best music about 9.45 onwards. Enjoy
Great music and great tasting beers. Just turn up, grab a chair and listen to the music. If you like blues you'll love this place
These guys are incredible!!! Live music is amazing, nice setting, its a must go place while in Chiang Mai.

I have visited this bar several times over the past few years and it consistently delivers excellent music. The crowd seems to be an eclectic mix of local expats and tourists. I like to go on Monday nights when different musicians play, like a jam session. The bands play a mix of classic rock, blues which is great as they are my preferred music. A great place to listen to live music.

This bar is situated right near night bizarre and is somewhere my partner and I visited most nights in chaing mai. It has a fantastic live band which interacts with the audience and drinks are a reasonable price. It has a relaxed yet uplifting vibe that is the perfect way to spend an evening in chaing mai.

I visited this place after seeing the reviews on here, I am a singer in a band as a profession so love going to watch other musicians. Its right in the middle of the market, i was downstairs getting a manicure and pedicure for an hour listening to them before I went up to the bar! They have continuous music all night, changing the bands over at certain points of the night. Both bands i saw were amazing and talented, and it was refreshing to hear songs performed in their own style, with a mixture of music from Motown, Indie, Rock (Ben E King, The Killers, Eric Clapton etc) The vibe was great, complete mixture of people, young and old, from all parts of the world, and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The waitress was very good and fast, and not pestering for tips which is my pet peeve. Great vibe, great music, not expensive, and its easy to get transport home afterwards by tuk tuk or taxi from right outside.
We were with another couple and enjoyed a very good live band show. Prices for drinks were OK and we really had a good time.

took me three days to find this place but when i did it was outstanding ,its in the middle of the night markets so look up to see the sign cant remember exactly where but the musicians are sensational wanted to jam with them but wrong night.really cool amphitheatre feel.
