Hidden inside a covered mall is a fantastic little open aired bar called Boy Blues Bar. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it blew me away. Bands on from 5pm to midnight (just wished it stayed open later), Talent everywhere.

We have been going to Chiang Mai for the last 5 years or,so and two years ago we were eating in the night bazaar and heard blues music come from somewhere but not sure where. We then discovered Boy Blues Bar and we were blown away by the awesome music. It is now a must on our itinerary. Going again in two weeks time and will definitely be paying a visit or two. Great night out and worth a go.

We came to take a beer with many friends, and the playing groups was very nice (3 groups along the evening). The price of the refreshment are a little more expensive than other place in the city, but I think it's to pay the artist so no soucis ! (40 THB for on coke).It's very an original place, and the atmosphere is very warm. But I do not recommend this place if you want to talk with your friend. The music is a little bit too loud (live music !) to be able to speak easily. But if you want live music and good ambiance I really recommend this place !

Wow, was that ever impressive. Worth going out of your way to see Boy in action. He will make you smile. It's upstairs off Soi 6 of the Night Bazaar road (Changklan Road) Look for the big "Le Spice" sign and go a little further down and turn left into the Kalare Night Market.

While in Chiang Mai we had the opportunity to go to Boy Blues Bar on three occasions. The first couple of times was on a Monday night which is open mic nights. Great time with a talented group of locals who obviously really enjoy their music. The other night was a Friday. What a fantastic evening. Boy can really make his guitar sing and his voice was a wonderful surprise. His band also obviously enjoy their music and we're equally talented as was shown when they all took a turn at demonstrating their skills. Boy is also a great showman and we came away from each of our experiences feeling incredibly energized by some amazing music. Thanks to all you guys. Not to be missed if you are on Chiang Mai.

Located in the Kalare Night Bazaar, Boy Blues bar is a great venue for residents including expats and tourists and everyone is welcomed. Boy and his band provide the music, which is great. The atmosphere is relaxed and good fun. Would be performers are invited to play as well. Drinks well priced for the city centre and if you ask, they will allow you to bring in food from other venues to eat while you enjoy the drinks and music at the bar. It is upstairs, so go to the area near the stage downstairs and look for the neon sign.

Located upstairs at the Kalare Food market this venue is worth checking out. It opens at 8.00pm and a band starts playing shortly after. There is no fee to go in. The Boys Blues band played for the first hour and they were excellent. Good tunes and very entertaining. Different bands come on throughout the evening. The venue is small and can fill up quickly so arrive early.

This unusual bar is located up some stairs above a market. In the 2 hours+ that I was there it offered free music from three different bands. The ambiance is good, there is a mix of all ages, and drink prices were very reasonable. Definitely worth a visit.

If you're into live music, these guys are a must. Not sure why, but there's a lot of live music in Chiang Mai. This blew everyone else out of the water. Absolutely worth grabbing a beer and spending an hour ( or 3 ) listening to Boy and friends. They're having just as much as you are, which makes for a great evening.

There is limited nightlife in Chiang Mai with live music. Three piece band with 5 minute lead guitar solos and even a bass guitar solo thrown in. Small venue but great music whilst drinking a beer. Located on Chiang Klan Rd Kalare Complex mezzanine level near food court in the middle of the night bazzar.
Great atmosphere and awesome live music. Covers of Hendrix and Marley along with some proper blues jams are refreshing in what seems an otherwise pop-heavy music scene.
Beer ain't over priced either. A hassle free place to enjoy break in the middle of the night bazaar. Wouldn't go out of my way to come here but worth a stop if you're in the night bazaar.

If you are a rock/blues music lover this is a must to go to chill out in the evening. The resident band is amazing and I could not believe that those Thai guys could have such a great mood for the blues. They got the "blue note" in their souls. Honest drink prices and non pushing waitresses complete the great offer.

A range of musicians pass through the venue jamming and singing to songs that are blues standards or have loose connections to them. The delivery can be laidback laconic with a fair bit of proficiency and always passion. The feet and toes cannot stop tapping. The hard working staff ensure that a Beveridge is always available as needed.

Imagine you are walking around the night bazaar and while youre looking at stuff your ears are filled with good blues boogie blasting from somewhere in the market. You start walking to investigate where this great music is coming from. You realize its coming from a location above you. You walk around to find the entrance, up the stairs you go and out into a large, open mezzanine floor of tables and live music. Place is frequented by foreigners and Thais. Drinks are well priced and there are 3 bands a night, each playing about an hour per set. Most is very good quality American blues, as good as anywhere and remember these guys are all Thai. Monday nights bring open mic night and usually there are foreign musicians playing too. Saturday night has a regular Thai disco group playing all classic disco songs and they are fantastic! People were dancing on the tables, I was waiting for tables to break. A great place not to be missed if you are in Chiang Mai. Music level is not too loud so you can talk easily but loud enough for those wanting to party hard.
Having wondered the night market this is a perfect place to sit, relax and soak in the atmosphere. Great music, lively staff and atmospheric surroundings - you must go!
Great music we were there on open microphone nigh which was interesting at times.drinks were reasonably priced and really good crowd .

By accident ran into this bar whilst walking the night market. Live band playing good blues music every night, so ended up here every night. Good prices, great atmosphere and last but not least great music played live.
Best night out in a very long time. Wonderful to find other people over 55 that still rock their socks off. Fantastic talent at open mike night. Will give it another go later in the week.

We found this place by accident. We followed the sound of the band til we found the bar. The music was very good, the staff were friendly and the drinks were decently priced. No cocktail menu but they will try to mix you what you want. Very nice place to chill and escape Thai rain.

Went to the night market and while walking around I could hear some great sounds from somewhere... Hard to find the entrance to this small bar above the market but do it... House band have a guy leading them who is a wizard with the guitar. Obviously Hendrix motivated and not bad for it. I went two nights running. Differs t bands and singers each night... Simpler fabulous. In England this ace would be packed to the rafters every night. Beer is 110 baht for a small bottle so bit extortionate. The entry is free. Find it and enjoy... Awesome. In the market above the more boutique stalls. Toilets are in the market underneath. Just go!!!

My cousin recommended that we spend an evening at this bar. And I am really glad we did! If you're into blues music this is a great way to spend an evening. It is an open top bar situated by the night market making for a cool and pleasant environment. The musicians are really polished performers and play many classics. The efficient bar woman will bring you your beer and you can have food delivered from one of the nearby restaurants. There is no cover charge but a donation box. Highly recommend dropping in to check it out!
Great music, atmosphere and a fun vibe. Spent an hour or so here after shopping in the night bazaar & wished we'd had more time. Our daughters who are in their twenties enjoyed it too

So cool, even if you don’t care for blues music , great venue very rough and ready , the band changes through the night and the owner always plays guitar and sings , great vibe definitely worth a visit , set inside the night market easy to find just follow the blues !

Low key, open air venue located in the night market area. The reason I can't give it 5 stars is because I went anticipating blues, but instead it was classic rock/70s-90s music. While it was still a fun time, it wasn't exactly what I was counting on. Relaxed environment and energetic bands make it worth a visit.
We found this bar the last day for our trip what an awesome place !! If i had know it was there at the beginning of our trip we would have spent every night there. Can't be missed !!!

boy blues bar is a great place to spend an evening or 100!! set above kalare night market in chiang mai on a mezzanine floor it is like being in someone,s tree house away from all cares and woes....it is not a girly bar...the drinks are reasonable...the entertainment is great with 2 to 3 bands everynight [apart from sunday when it,s closed] and it,s fee!! boy...the owner...plays a mean guitar and is an outgoing animated soul who makes one and all feel at home!! i am in love with this place and can see why it is one of the best venues in thailand!! blues omits passion and this place offers just that!! come and see for yourself!! XX jojo
We loved it here and during our week stay visited 3 times. The music and atmosphere is amazing we were really blown away at the quality of the musicians.

This place has beer that is not too expensive and live music. The bands are trios: Guitar,bass, drums, playing rock -- some of them are very good, some not as good. The audience is almost entirely tourists.
Nice outdoor bar featuring local and foreign talent. Monday is open mike night and can be quite entertaining. No one bothers you at this bar. Mellow vibe and cool.

Visited Boy Blues Bar a few times on this trip and always enjoyed myself as did the crowd there. There is plenty of seating and an efficient bar staff with reasonable priced beer considering the entertainment. The variety of muso's were good to very good. As others have said..Boy is the performer always having fun along the way. Highly recommend. 👍

If you really love fantastic live music then you MUST go to Boy Blues bar. Fantastic atmosphere and amazing music. Boy and the band are great. I have even taken my young sons there for the early part of the night. They loved Boy. Other patrons are well behaved and friendly making any visit there a complete treat. I'm not such a fan of the open mike nitre as you get a mixed bag. But that's what there all about. This is great night out. Not to be missed.
This place had wonderful music and a very easy going environment. Was really nice getting a beer and hanging out for the night. Would definitely recommend.

Just follow the music! You'll hear it straight away when you get into the Night Bazar. Great atmosphere, and Boy himself sure knows how to handle the guitar!! Monday evenings are jam nights - a complete mix of styles. You will not be disappointed!!

Great little find above the night bazaar for expats and tourists alike. A couple of really good bands played while we were there. Great place to sit and drink a few beers and get away from the hustle of the night markets
if you like some live music or some blues this is really the place to go for a great evening. on of the best bars in town

After listening to some Hendrix whilst dining downstairs just had to have a look followed the stairs to a bar in the night Bazaar these dude's really know their craft... Pity the drinks menu is limited but will go again

We visited here quite late on Saturday night. Weren't out to go here initally but more a case of stumbling upon it by way of following the sound of the music. First impression was of a little gem hidden away from everyone as it's upstairs in the market. On arrival we were seated and given the drinks menu. Drinks are slightly more expensive but there again you also have great live music included. The two groups were VERY GOOD indeed. This place has a very nice atmosphere . The first group played rock jazz and they could teach other "well known" groups a thing or two on playing live music! A well recommend place to visit if you enjoy live music and a chilled out party atmosphere . Thumbs up for me.

Not your normal location for a blue's bar. This place is sitting right above the Night Bazaar in Chiang Mai. Not saying I don't like it, but it was different. There are actually some upsides to the location. One, the smoke clears out quickly if the air circulates. Two, there is plenty of room to sit. The drinks were overpriced... at least a bottle of coke was. Equivalent of $1.40/bottle in a town where you usually don't pay more than 50 cents. Now for the best part, the MUSIC. Very talented folks playing and the singing was good as well. There was a band already playing when I arrived and at 9:30, Boy stepped up and took the mic. Even though he probably plays every night, he looked like he was still having a great time. This to me looks like the perfect place to hang out and enjoy great music when your friends want to go to the Nigh Bazaar.

This is a small venue upstairs in the night market, classic rock and blues played by some accomplished musicians. Good service, cold beer and good mixed drinks. The sound level is perfect, great to hang out and chat and enjoy the bands. Great prices and good service, we stopped by nightly as we were staying close by.

My first visit to Boy Blues Bar on their regular Monday evening JAMMIN session was great ! So many talented musicians from around the World.! Great atmosphere .....fab night out! Live music every evening also.
We had a great time at this bar this evening. The band were amazing and so were the drinks! So great to see so many people having a great time.
We went here after overhearing music in the market area and what a great time we had the bands who play are exceptional we were very impressed!!!

This was a hidden gem that we discovered and well worth making a deliberate detour too. Especially at about 9pm, it really starts to slide into a nice chilled get together jam vibe. Small gathering on a roof top....drinks good...servoce friendly...atmosphere relaxed...a breeze when downstairs there just isnt one...and a cosy crowd among the bluesy tunes.

A Thai friend took me to this bar and it was fantastic. We had enjoyed a meal at the nearby night bazaar and this rounded off a great night. Great music and reasonable priced drinks. I think it is not open Sunday. It is up a few stairs but go and enjoy the craic.
Nice location and good atmosphere and an interesting range of music but the drinks are expensive which is a shame and cut short out visit

This place was a really chill spot. If you like live blues music and drinks, then this place is for you. The music was awesome. It is a small spot but plenty of seats. Great place to come relax after exploring the night bazaar.

What more could you ask for, blues music served up in abundance by the Chiang Mai legend himself plus an ever changing line up of very talented musicians throughout the night. If your in the area have a look upstairs. i'm sure you'll be glad you did.

If you are a musician - guitarist, bassist, drummer or anything on the same level - this is is a place you need to go to. A few bands played and each band was TIGHT, i heard some terrific guitar, bass and a outstanding drum solo but all at the same time staying in the blues sort genre. I couldn't believe that there was a place that played music as well as these bands did. It gets busy, so get there just after 8 or when it opens to get a good seat. Oh and not to mention the service was great, didnt have to get up once of the two nights i went to order a drink, instead they came to me. A must go for one who loves good music and good vibes!
A mixture of 70s college jam sessions and talent night. The bands were not bad and drinks were cheap. The place was a little crowded but who cares - keep the drinks flowing.

Like most people, we stumbled across this when walking through the markets.. The bands were so much fun and staff very good and smiley like all the people in Chiang Mai.. Loved it so much we went back 3 nights on the bounce! Shout out to Boy who looked like he was having the time of his life every time he performed and made everyone feel welcome.

Boy is a top guy and great muso. Band is tight and was tight the 3 nights we finished our nights off there! Gig night was great fun and everyone had a top night. Drinks are priced well and cold. If your in Chiang Mai do yourself a favour and visit Boy Blues Bar for some great tunes, cold drinks and holiday memories you will talk about for a while, we are including our 5yo daughter that had a ball! Thanks guys keep up the great work and see you all agian soon.

This little gem is tucked inside the night market and has EXCELLENT shows, with a bar, seating and no cover charge. So happy to have been introduced to this spot, where the owner radiates passion as he strums his electric guitar.
The Monday night jamming sessions are fantastic. As a regular of the old drunken flower I was delighted that Boy took this to the next level. His bar is excellent.

If you are looking for some entertainment, this is a great place with live musicians. The bar is nicely located and the staff is very friendly. It is a must stop in the evening if you want to chill and have a good time

Having been involved in the Sixties music scene in the UK, a fabulous time, I appreciate that Boi is a great character who can produce fabulous sounds from his guitar perhaps an equal Hendrix, while fronting his house band at the Blues Bar. Whenever I am in Chiang Mai, a visit is top of my list. Usually packed which suggests a 'must do' for you too! However, if you are one of the disrespectful idiots who prefers to talk loudly rather than enjoying the music, then do us all a favour and go elsewhere. Music lovers are most welcome ... many are regulars.

The best bar in Chang Mai (all of Thai Land). Went nearly ever night when I was in Chang Mai and the talent was just phenomenal!!! Open mic night was probably the best on a Monday night and the place gets pretty packed for it. Boy blues band play the other nights and are just brilliant and it’s perfect a perfect hide away during the rain (if you need an excuse) great service for drinks and pretty cheap!! A must go place!!

So don't be fooled by the name of this bar.. it is not a Blues music bar, whether it just wasn't on on the night we visited I dont know. The first band were a tock band and quite good then what followed was old balding white men with guitars! This place is obviously a hook up for single white men to meet Thai women as we saw numerous single white men enter to then be targeted by Thai women. Its a little bit sleazy and as a two women we found it quite uncomfortable. If you are under 45 I wouldn't bother going here.. it was quite a let down.
Been to Chiang Mai many times and always visit this place. The owner is gem and the music he plays with his band and the many guest musicians is euphoric!

I found this bar on Trip Advisor and what a lucky find it was. I'm a big blues fan and Boy and his band were great. He plays a very classic style of blues but with his own unique style. Drinks very reasonably priced, no food but there's a big food court downstairs from his bar. It's an open-air venue so the sound isn't great but it wasn't too bad. I've been very impressed with the music I've seen in Thailand, at Ad Here and Saxophone in Bangkok and the Bear Bar around the corner from this place, I'm looking forward to checking out more of the great musicians Thailand seems to have!
Live music played by pretty good blues band. Beer and beverage is Not expensive. If you love blues and want to find a bar, it is the perfect place to go.

What a fun time. We came here because of the good reviews, and also because we love live music. We weren't disappointed. Great music, fun time, good location above the night market. It was packed but not too hot with the breeze blowing. At one point in the evening, and old Burmese (I think) man with his family at the next table starting dancing national dance. Was wonderful. We will definilely go to this bar each time we visit Chiang Mai.
A great spot to come and hear some fantastic Blues and relax for the good Brew or some snack food. Boy blues is known all over Chiang Mai and is very popular.

First drink was single shot with ginger ale, tasted watery . The next one I thought right, double and just put like quarter among of ale, look I love Sailor Jerry, I was there to see them put two shot, tasted like weak sailor Jerry's..... and I love blues.... But I don't like their mix... Just saying.
Monday nights are a must do, with live open mic. Super fun atmosphere for all ages and picks up a lil later for the more seasoned drinkers. Located above the night market.

Having visited this bar before on previous trips I had to go again as its one of the best blues bars you will find. Entry is free and due to its location just above the night market it attracts passing visitors who can hear the music. Various bands turn up to play and ex pats join in from time to time. Boy is a charming man, hugely talented, and his range of music tends to favour Hendrix style. His base and drummer are superb also. Super atmosphere and highly recommended.

On heading to a night market I'm Chiang Mai the last thing you would expect is a blues band in the middle of it. The Boys Blue bar atmosphere was chilled, staff were friendly and the band was AWESOME! Very talented band. If you love blues or want a good night out.. Definetly recommend.

Read about this bar before visiting. Got there around 9:30, thought it was easy enough to find just by hearing it while in the night bazar. Cool little set up and seated straight away and given menu. Beers and spirits so pretty simple. We saw 3 bands, first one wasn’t great, last one was very cheesy and not great. Middle one however called boy blues band were class. These are clearly why everyone goes, they can really play and the singer definitely has a bit of charisma. Great for a nights entertainment.

Was recently invited here by one of the locals for the Monday night jam session. Run by Boy and frequented by local expats the line up continually changes as they each join in belting out a few songs. What a great place that I have never come across before. My intention was to go for an hour or two and I ended up staying till closing. For anyone into blues music I can recommend the place.

Situated on a mezzanine floor in the Kalare Night Bazaar. Open 20.30-24.00. 3 live blues/rock bands every night. Very reasonably priced drinks. Table service. Personal favourites are thurs, fri, sat nights. 2nd band on Boys Blues Band. Also Mondays open mike jam night. No food. Accessible only by stairs. Free entry.

We really enjoyed our visit to the boy blues bar. We had heard that the music could be hit and miss, luckily the evening we were there both bands were really good. Drinks are a little spendy - stick to beer. No food is served. It is located in the night bazaar, so it is worth going to the bazaar for a look and some food and capping it off at the boy blues bar.

Very good vib, good priced drinks, good music. Blues only on Thursday to Sat when we were there. Boy Blues plans then. We missed the blues but the rock and roll music was very good. The GPS location shown on Trip Advisor is correct, right on, but you need to go into the center of the Bazaar to find it, not on the street. Listen for the music. Or ask someone and if they know, you just might have meet a new friend...we did! Also if Blue, the owner and band leader is there, talk to him. He is super nice. Also, staff is nice. It doesn't get much better than this!

We stumbled across this place - or rather heard it as some serious guitar playing drifted across the surrounding night market - and found a pretty decent level of musicians playing an open mic night. By the look of it, some are regulars in a local scene and we caught one of the singers giving it some again at another nearby venue the next night. The beers are inexpensive, entry is free and the crowd eclectic. I'd recommend this over the trashy and fairly pointless lady boy cabaret show a short walk away.

Really enjoyed visiting here and seeing Boy and his live band - they're very good. It's in a great position, above the Night Bazaar, so you can eat and shop before going up to wind down the evening to some good tunes.
Talented musicians. Great night. Will certainly return. Good wide cross section of music, from 60's & 70's to 90's. Boy Blue himself is very good but so are his accomplices.

We stumbled upon this bar while shopping in the night market and I am so glad we did. The band that was playing (not sure if they play every night) was amazing and played fun throwback songs. Drinks seemed pretty standard, about 90 baht for a small Singha. My only complaint is that I wish they were open past midnight but we went on a Wednesday so maybe they are on weekends.

The place is not suitable for socializing - it has a concept of a tiny theater. Musicians were pretty bad, and the prices are a little bit above average. Drinks menu is outdated. My advice - go to Anusan Sunthon, Anusarn market, there are plenty of nice places, including ones with live music.
We were there on a Saturday and the music and the atmosphere was really nice and the drinks are quite cheap as well. It s a good spot if you are on the night bazaar anyways.

Spent two nights in Chiang Mai and ended up here both nights. Great place and great music. Cool spot overlooking the night bazaar and just an overall fun time. Monday nights is open mic night and the other nights i think random bands play and the owner (Boy) finishes off the night. He's a great performer and amazing musican.

Always a treat to return here and hear the talented Boy and his band play plus other musicians. No admission charge with reasonably priced drinks. If you enjoy live music, this is a small and personal venue, well worth supporting.

Great music if you like blues, rock. Can get a bit monotonous if you go every night. Mostly same sort of sets. Monday night is jamming and different. Boy is a great guitarist and performer, and smashing bloke also. Girls are nice, and efficient, and beer prices are reasonable.

I try to see live music at least once a week back home. I spontaneously decided to stop by this place after reading about it on this site. One of the best decisions I've made on this trip - if you want to see incredible talent and have a chill night out, come here. The owner, Boy, is the man, and his band is phenomenal. When they aren't playing, he has famous and highly talented bands play. Chiang Mai was one stop for me on a short trip and I've been here 3 nights. Follow my advice and come - enjoy!

Found this place quite by accident while walking around a night bazaar and hearing some music. Decided to kill some time while the rain finished and it was well worth it. First saw Boys (the owner) band followed by a young local band. Well worth a visit on an evening for a few beers and the local music
Absolutely awesome! Love it. Great atmosphere and excellent service. Live bands some local some not. Great sounds groovy beats happy days. :-) will be back for sure.

Imagine everything that you think a blues bar should be then rip it up and throw it away. Imagine everything that you want a blues bar to be, then prepare yourself for the unexpected. Nothing about this place works, but everything about this place works. That’s the enigma. Try and find it, it’s in the middle of a night market bazaar, on top of a metal platform. Why would anyone think of putting a bar there and why would anyone want to go there. There is something or someone special, the someone is Boy and the something is how he attracts people to his bar. If you are an open mike blues player, this is where you should want to play, and if you appreciate anyone who has the courage to perform blues, live on stage, then this is the place to go. Monday Night at Boy Blues Bar is like a bucket list item, you have to go there at least once in your life, it is that good.

I came here with friends last week. It was a little hard to find but in the end all we had to do was follow the music. The music was AMAZING and the atmosphere was relaxing. Unfortunately there were some let downs though. The bar staff were very unorganized and it took over 20 minutes to get served even though there was only 2 people at the bar getting drinks. The system in which the bar operated needs to be fixed, as there is no need for 3-4 people organizing drinks for only one person serving the drinks. To me it was a major let down, even though the music was amazing. The other thing was the seating, Even though the venue is small and "boutique" the seating could have been more comfortable than some wooden benches. I know this review sounds harsh but it is based on the experience of me and 3 of my friends. Saying this, I may return in the future but only for the Best Blues in Chiang Mai.
Great music, no cover charge, table service from attentive staff all go to make this one of the best nights out in CM, not necessarily the cheapest mind but thoroughly worth every penny!
You'll hear the music as you walk around the night bazar. Great performances and the atmosphere is great in open air. Good blues. Recommended.
This cute little place was recommended to us by the owner of the hostel we stayed at in Chiang Mai. We visited during a jam session and boy was it good. Highly recommended if you are in the area.

Spent a few hours over a couple of nights at this fantastic little bar with awesome music! Nice casual relaxed atmosphere, cheap drinks and really really great music. We had actually forgotten this bar existed and then stumbled upon it again when walking around Kalare markets late in the evening. Once you hear that music you can't can't help but follow it upstairs and you will be very glad you did. It's one of the few places in Chiang Mai where you can go and listen to good quality live music, have a few drinks and be totally relaxed. Recommend highly if you like good live music.
We've been here 1,5 years ago and were lucky to find this nice place again. The owner, who plays here every night is a great player with great feeling, big fun and has a great band! Love it!
Great bands playing great music on a rooftop bar. Great blues and funk. Cheep cold beer. Adult place with seating and elbow room. Great service too. No admission fee. Going again tonight.

Boy is a legend ... this place is amazing! We stumbled across this gem on a Monday night, open mic night and we loved every minute of it. All the acts were pretty damn good and the atmosphere was buzzing. If you are in Chaing Mai and love live music give this place a go. It wont disappoint.

It's a smaller bar, but that adds to the atmosphere. Drink prices are fair, at least by US standards. The live music was good, not quite as blues-y as expected, but still enjoyable. If you've got a free night, or even just an hour, it's worth checking out.

After all the good reviews we went there for the music. Music was ok BUT The service was terrible - he arrived with a rumcola without any gas; after complaining the guy first got angry and then just left us there sitting. No reaction whatsoever. And last - i was not even sure, based on the scenes we were watching, whether this wasnt a place where western went to meet with local girls. To many couples forming happening in a short time for my taste. I for my part will never be back.
Great music by both the warm up band and the featured band. Lovely roof top setting. Drinks are reasonably priced. Really enjoyed our night there.

Great place to listen to some blues in the centre of Chiang Mai. Monday nights are `jam nights`,so get there early,if you want a seat...it can get very busy. Boy plays with his band everynight(except Sundays,when bar is closed) and occassionally Claire,his wife will get up to sing and she has a great voice. A definate treat,if your looking for a place to relax,listen to some great blues and meet interesting people.
amazing music .. good prices .. went with my friends love the music they played .. recommended to all good music lovers!

Ok so i've been to jazz Bars in America, Europe, and Asia. But never to a blues bar mostly because i've never been able to find one. this place BLEW my mind. We were in the night bazaar one day looking for it and couldn't find it and one night when we went back and just ran into it. The original plan was to spend about an hour there and we ended up spending about 3. The music was INCREDIBLE, the ambiance even more so. Every time my beer was even close to empty the waitress was right there ready to offer me another one. As the night progressed the music only kept getting better, the house band (whose also the owner) was incredible. You can tell that even after doing for god knows how many years he was still incredibly happy to be doing it. The only complaint I could possibly have is that the chairs were not the most comfortable in the world but they also give it that raw organic feeling that you would of gotten back in the day when the blues was king. I would recommend this to not only Blues lovers but musical lovers of all taste.
THis is a great bar in the night bazaar. The lead is a charismatic Thai guitar player with a great voice. They play blues and rock n' roll standards. Great night out.

A pretty basic bar, but with great service, smiling faces, but what this makes this place so special is Boy Blues and his terrific band. Can they play the blues, oh yeah. Boy Blues never stops smiling and the music is really, really good. Couldn't recommend more. Thanks for some great nights.

This is a rough and ready little gem that we stubbled upon through the market to avoid the rain. Boy plays fantastic blues with his band and then other local bands step up. Tuesday nights late band was our absolute fave. We went back a couple of times during our stay, everyone must visit!
Very good Bands and Good Beer.... The Service is very friendly :-) Is in the middle of the Night-Market, which is beautiful as well.

Kinda hard to find...but wander through the market and follow the sounds of the music until you find the stairs leading up to Boys Blues. It’s an outside venue with lots of fans to keep you cool. The bass player lays down a mean bass track. Another live music highlight in Chiang Mai!
Stumbled into the bar during our first night in chiang mai as we were wandering round the night bazaar. The band were incredible!! We stayed all night, fantastic music and atmosphere!

This place got many good reviews so I made a point of checking it out. The first night seemed to be jam night and it was a bit patchy. Some of the musicians were OK but some of thm were pretty bad. I thought I'd give it another chance and on the next night, the owner was playing and his band was much better. There were still people jamming but they could actually play! Overall, it seems quite good but you need to pick your night!
It is always super to come back to this blue bar! It serves blues with a smile from Boy, the owner and the band's guitarist.

This was recommended to us by another bar owner, however the directions given turned out to be quite vague and on our first attempt didn't find it! We did find it by accident when looking around the Kalare Night Market, it's up some stairs and doesn't open until after 9pm when the band can be heard. An unusual location and I wasn't sure what to expect. A great night's entertainment but only if you like rock/blues don't go expecting a 'sing a long' bar, you won't get it. The band had various guest musicians and the quality was quite amazing, but at times there was too much wandering away from the song for me. Well worth a visit if you are really in to the blues. Good waiter service, cash as you go.
Nice bar with a live music. The atmosphere is fun, full of laughter, great music and good drinks. Can be a bit hard to find, but if you do try and stay till the end.
Laid back atmosphere, almost constant live music, mostly blues. House band very good! We enjoyed it, didn't find anything else on Chiang Mai to equal it!

This bar is a gem. Find it in night market. Don't go to Chiang Mai and not go here. So friendly and very surprising as to the quality of music, both local and ex pat. Some wonderful talent with many interesting instruments appearing from time to time out of the audience. Mine host is a charmer. Now my third visit but first time on holiday with family and was not disappointed.

Not the easiest place to find, but well and truly worth the effort! Great music, great atmosphere and cold beer. Good mix of music and some seriously talented musos. Boy is a great host and has some serious talent himself. Highly recommended - treat yourself!

If you appreciate good music and enjoy a drink come to the boy blues bar. Great music and a range of guest performers - you wouldn't expect to find in chiang mai. Monday night is an all in jam session not to be missed!

Boy Blues Bar is fantastic - incredible atmosphere, reasonably priced drinks and great music. We came here every night of our 5 day stay except for when it was closed on Sunday. Recommended is Monday the jamming night, but this gets very busy so get there early if you want a seat! It is not obvious where to find it - it is in the Center of the Kalare night Bazaar - find it by following the music. Thanks Boy Blue for a fab time!

I must have been here at the wrong time. First night I came, they were having a open mike night and all they play was Eric Clapton Wonderful Tonight kinda music. I read the review and saw people raving about the blues so I came back the next night and they were playing Steely Dan type of music. I gave up. I guess one man's blues is another man's bubblegum.

This is a brilliant place to visit - my friends and I truly didn't want to leave. Even if you aren't into blues, you should pay a visit to this bar for the atmosphere. Travellers from all over gather, drink, sing and dance and it's just so much fun. It would be even better if it served cocktails as well as beer, but having the occasional Chang isn't too bad anyway! Boy rocks!!!
A cool place hidden above a night market. Cosy vibe with great blues band. Reasonably priced drinks and you can always pop downstairs if youre hungry. A hidden gem.

The first time we came across Boy's bar, we were amazed! Such great music, and fantastic atmosphere. Boy makes a great connection with the audience and is very charismatic, as well as a superb musician. We had the best New Years Eve ever here. But as they say, you can't look back, and subsequent visits although still fun, have been repetitive. Same sets played by the same bands. Open mic night was somewhat embarrassing, with the aging falang population trying to relive their long forgotten youth. A must visit . Once.

We landed at this place at the night market on Monday and found out that is the day there is an open mic at the Boy Blues Bar. No place to sit, we still stayed for the music and the beers etc. Not expensive at all and great fun. Went there three nights in a row after.

Went here on our first evening in Chiang Mai after reading reviews and it lived up to it. Very relaxed atmosphere, great music.. if you stay long enough to hear boy play, he is truly great and has loads of charisma. Went back for another evening before leaving Chiang Mai.

This bar is in a covered outdoor area on the roof of a market just off the Night Bazaar in Chiang Mai. The owner is a blues guitarist and he knows his stuff. The three piece band were tight and a pleasure to listen. They were followed by a very professional funk outfit. Basically, you go there to listen to music and have a few drinks. No food available and you pay as you go even though the drinks are delivered to you. A cool breeze blows through the venue and seats are set up so that, no matter where you sit you can see the musicians. We will go back again before we leave if we have time.
Go there if you want to listen to good live music. Blues, rock, the likes. It's one of those places where it's all about the experience. Don't go there if you don't generally go to live gigs.

If you smoke and/or enjoy second-hand smoke, this is the place for you. Almost everyone smokes, and although the place is on the 2nd floor without walls, the accumulated smoke is overwhelming. I think it would be great if management can allocate a spot for non-smokers, but that is a long shot. Having said that, the music can vary from very good to terrible. Boy and the instrumental musicians are very good, but the vocals by some during the open-mic is the worst at its best. The house band is good, the service is good, and Boy (the owner) seems like a truly nice and caring person with a ton of tolerance and a perpetual smile adoring his face. So, if you are not bothered by smoke, you should definitely give it a try, especially on a Monday during open-mic and experience what could be a great musical evening sprinkled with some frustrated vocalists who should be constrained to singing in the shower.

Just got back from our 2nd night at Boy Blues Band. Great music and Boy Blue is having so much fun playing it that it is infectious and you have to have a good time in the audience. He had a local harpist and singer join his band on stage and they were all great.

Boy Blues Bar is a great way to spend a night out. With live jazz and friendly staff, everyone mingles with one another to create a good vibe. This is definitely one of my favorite places to go for a relaxing drink.

Walking at the night market and was pulled by this music coming from the Boys Blue Bar. This is the place where they play great music. Monday is open mic and it gets crazy fun! All those seriously talented musicians and then the frustrated ones all together is just awesome! Definitely a must-experience when you go to Chiang Mai.

Located above the market the bar plays blues/rock music every night, the open mic night was particularly crowded, A beer was Bht90 which I thought wasn't bad with the music thrown in. Both the regular crowd and staff were friendly

I don't know if its just me or what. I read the reviews here, it's all fantastic but when I went there with a friend, I saw the people's reactions, it was like they were about to sleep or something. I don't get it.

When Boy himself is playing this place is 5 star. I drop one star due to sour faced girl who is serving there each night. She always seems put out when you want a drink. Three others sitting behind bar doing little, yet it's hard to get their attention for another drink. All absolutely worthwhile just to watch and hear Boy sing. He's infectious smile and awesome style. Could watch him all night. Don't let the cranky faced girl turn you off this place 😀

We just chanced upon this place, wandering around an almost empty night market. We were thirsty and went up for a beer. The bar was quite empty too, but it started to fill up, and soon was standing room only. It turned out to be open mike night with an amazing atmosphere. We made some new friends (one of the singers - really good) and had a great time.

These guys know their blues. So much local talent in CM....wow !! This was our last evening in CM. Last nite we'd been to Roots Rock and Reggae and came back sufficiently impressed with the 2 bands that were playing. The first one Croissant reproduced Marley and Reggae almost to perfection. The 2nd band was also amazing with 2 horn trumpets at their best and a killer bass. So we went to this place not expecting anything great.....and " boy " we were shocked with the quality of blues ( Chicago blues ) the 3 piece band dished out !! Needless to say the mixed crowd is friendly. If you like blues, dont miss this place !!
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

comment: Been here many times and know Boy, the main guitarist and owner, quite well. It's an open air mezzanine bar in the enclosed night bazaar of Chiang Mai. It's a bit awkward to find but if you get into the enclosed area of the night bazaar, just follow the sound of the music. Entrance is free, no food is available and the beers cost about 100 baht. Boy and his band are great and play all evening, every evening, along with other guest musicians whenever they want to jam. The place is often very busy with tourists and local foreigners in the high tourist season. Most of the seats are a bit uncomfortable but tolerable when you listen to the great blues music from Boy. If I compare this with the other great live blues venue of the Brasserie, I would say the Brasserie is more convenient to find, provides food and had much better and more varied live blues music (in fact I understand that Took at Brasserie is the uncle of Boy and taught him to play the guitar) but Boy Blues bar is more popular, more open air and has a great atmosphere. Try both - you will not regret it.
Fantastic live music right in the centre of the night markets. Monday's is "Jam Session" so ensure that you get in early to get a seat.

After we finished our shopping, we decide to drink a bit before go back to hotel. I found this place on TripAdvisor, it is a nice place. Drink and enjoy the night life here. I am not the big fan of very loud music like night club, so this place is good for me. The next day in the morning , we recognize that I forgot the camera there. And we really cannot find the way to contact this place. in the evening we just go back there again and they still keep it for us. Thank you for this! If you have no idea for the place to drink, this place is not bad !
Came with some friends and really enjoyed Boy’s band. He is a very good blues guitarist. Great vibes to the bar. Drinks are reasonable

We had the opportunity to see Boy with his band, and another band right after them. Top musicians, clearly enjoying what they were playing, with a fantastic atmosphere. If you like the blues, this place is a must. I'm not commenting on the drinks or their prices, they're just an excuse to be there and listen to all that great music. If you find the drinks a bit on the expensive side, remember you don't have to buy a ticket to enter.

I went to the market at night with my girlfriend, I've traveled around Asia and the market was nothing to write home about....except for this place. After wallowing around for a hour we decided to try and liven up the night when we heard live music. She stopped me made me turn around, walked up stairs and spent the next two hours listening to brilliant live music, relaxing and downing extremely fairly priced drinks. So glad we found Boy Blues. Honestly, when I go back to Chiang Mai I will make a special trip back to the market to revisit this bar. Cheers!

Heard about this Chiang Mai Bar & Boy Blues Band from another hotel guest. Found it by accident late one night just before closing. Went back twice more and spent most of the evening listening! Thai Band is excellent! Incredible talent. Lead Guitarist (Boy) is awesome and thoroughly enjoys the performance (huge smile!), and you don't realise how good the Bass & Drummer are till they solo! Nibbles only, but Food Court downstairs. Even if you're not a fan of Blues music, this will convert you! Took another dubious hotel guest along the third night and I wouldn't be surprised if they went back again!

Whilst having dinner we heard blues music so decided to find out where this amazing music was coming from...... We walked upstairs to find this top deck bar with small stage. One of the best nights out in a long time, great local musicians, cold beer and an excellent atmosphere. On the night we were there a couple of kids went on stage, the youngest would have been around 6yrs old and playing the drums like a seasoned pro, his facial expression never changed throughout the three songs he drummed. The other kid would have been around 14 or so and man could this kid play the guitar.... Finishing off with some Hendrix, what a crowd pleaser these kids were, just truly amazing. Haven't checked YouTube yet, but the amount of phones recording this act I'm sure it's on there. Boy is a good operator, working the room making everyone feel welcome and ensuring the music is great, well done Boy an excellent night in Chaing Mai for us. Thank you
We came a Wednesday and the first band played from 8:30. We stayed for almost an hour. It was a good time and we would be happy to come back. The band played great.

If you like blues or R & B or Rock then do yourself a favour. The drinks are reasonably priced, the service is smooth and the music is hot. And this is Chiang Mai, I thought I was in Chicago or Cleveland. What are you waiting for? Up stairs in a night market building, you will hear it calling.

Live music is the highlight for this place. Nothing fancy but good music. Outdoor at the night market. Monday is open mike and possibly the best night to go. The owner is very kind and hospitable. Check it out.

This is a great place to hear good blues music. Located in one of the night markets you can shop eat and then walk over to the Boy Blues bar and enjoy a couple of hours of excellent music. Drink prices are very reasonable and there is only slight pressure to buy another drink which considering there was no enteance fee is understandable. If you like blues this is a must visit venue.

First of all, Boy the owner, is a funny little man with a huge spirit, and a true passion for what he does! Great :) as far as the music goes, they alle try their best, and so do some guest on open mike night, some less succesful than others, but I couldn't hold a key to save my life, so I'm not judging here. I've been to New Orleans more than once in my life, as well I have experienced truly amazing blues and jazz at many other destinations. Considering that this takes place in C.M. I think they are absolutely great! The only minor drag is that the bar has extremely limited variety. I don't do umbrellay drinks or anything like that (not that there would be space to make fancy cocktails behind that tiny busy bar anyways) but I am not a huge beer drinker, so I tend to go for a classic like G&T when no other choices. They do use generic spirits, not the best quality. Not expecting Hendricks gin, but I'd happily pay an extra 20 Bath to get a Bombay&tonic. Of course one should go for the live music and not the alcohol, just something that could the level up a notch. Anyways, been there a couple of times and have had a good time so would recommend
stumbled across this bar while perusing the night bazaar and even though it was barely full the energy in the place was awesome and the boy blues band is great.

We found this bar as we wandered around the markets and heard some funky beats drifting in the air.. The band are exciting and skilled. Two guys hopped up every once in a whie on a sax and trumpet to add some brass to the equation.. The seating is basic (If you get a seat that is!) and the prices are pretty good. There is no toilet, you have to walk down stairs and out through the market to use the bathroom. Bit of a pain but whatever.. A great place to have a few beers to live music in Chiang Mai

Having first seen this place when last in Chiang Mai four years ago, I was looking forward to returning. I was not disappointed and went three times, enjoying good music each time. I got to see the legendary Boy and his Blues Band play as an act on a Saturday night and as participating backup musicians during the “open mike” sessions on Monday night. It was relatively easy to get seats for the first two acts except during Monday night when the house was packed.

We stumbled on this place in the middle of night market stalls.The lead guitarist was fantastic in the house band.They were followed by an excellent young funk band.The bar is upstairs and a great escape from shopping! We went back a second night and enjoyed the excellent live music.Go here.

Stumbled upon this little gem wandering through the night markets. Became the highlight of chiang mai. Wonderful staff, friendly inviting atmosphere, cheap booze and astounding musicians. Definitely worth a visit!

Well what a surprise. We found this by accident. You can access this by going into the Kalare Night Market - it is up high and you may need to ask a smallholder where it is. Recommend Monday nights which is open mic nights. Incredible mix of talent. There is no admittance fee and no food available. It is required though that you purchase alcohol / soft drinks there. Donot take your own.

Monday Night is Open Mic Night it was our 2nd visit in so many days and Both Evenings we enjoyed But Monday Night was The Best such Talent and a Great Buzz plus the Drinks are very reasonably priced and Both Waitresses are Brilliant at keeping you supplied with Drinks which is far better then waiting to be served.. Boy is very enthusiastic and really enjoys playing he has a real stage presence do yourself a Favour and Go Along you won't be dissapointed.
